review_body: After looking for almost a year, and waiting months for an invite to purchase, I was able to order the PS5 disc edition and I cannot be more pleased.  I picked up Sackboy: A Big Adventure and Ratchet & Clank Rift Apart to start my library, and both are more than impressive.  The system is easy to set up, and the resolution is incredible, even on a non-4K television.  I am using a 1080p LG oled and the picture and frame rate is magnificent.  When I upgrade TV's later on, I can only imagine the difference.

review_title: Finally! Amazon makes getting a PS5 possible!
review_body: I've wanted a PS5 for a while now. Ironically, it has less to do with any PS5-exclusive games (you can count those on one hand, pretty much), but after getting a 4K TV, I wanted to see just how big of a difference there was in my existing PS4 library...plus, I wanted a PS5 anyway. Given the problematic microchip shortage (still aching to get a Raspberry Pi Zero 2 W, thanks scalpers), I wasn't confident in getting one of these anytime soon, not to mention the rampant scalping that is still ongoing. When I heard about Amazon's invitation approach, I thought "what the heck?" and gave it a shot. I got my invite days later, and pulled the trigger.I got a month of the Premium Plus membership, which I also heartily recommend, especially for those who are just starting too dip their toes into video games. It's a real good deal. Played through all of Dark Pictures: Little Hope and Ys IX, and a few game trials and more. It's at its best on the PS5, BTW. The system is excellent, but I should mention that at this time, it's essentially a "Super PS4 Pro". I know that this is consistent with new systems, and it appears that current global events are putting the stranglehold on more innovation, but I am glad to see some really awesome PS5 games coming soon, especially Alan Wake 2, Street Fighter 6, and more.I've just gotta say it. The system looks weird, and weirder still on its side. It comes with a base that does the job, but like my wife described it, it looks "melted". My own opinion, I think it's too much design, but don't judge a book by its cover. The system and interface is exceptional, and gameplay is wonderful. The controller has even more heft to it than the PS4 DualShock, probably thanks to all the little motors in it delivering haptic feedback. This takes a lot of getting used to, but it's so novel that I'm more intrigued by it than anything else.I'm really glad to get one of these, even if it was at full MSRP. (I usually wait for Black Friday deals, but given the current climate for microprocessors and the demand of these, I wasn't counting on this for at least a couple of years.) For anyone who has struggled to get one, really just request an invite. No obligation, but mine literally shipped and arrived the day I ordered it. No other business is even coming close to as (frankly) elegant way of fighting the scalpers on this front than Amazon. Now if they would just do the same for those Raspberry Pis, I'd be thrilled!

After two years of searching and months being on the Amazon waitlist‚Ä¶I got the email to purchase a PS5! Love the console. It‚Äôs bigger than I thought it would be, but it‚Äôs super quite and fast. I loved that all the games I had in the cloud could be retrieved on here and all of my saves moved over. That took about 2 hours, but it was well worth it. I‚Äôve been using for a few mo that now and the white controller is still as bright as it was out of the box. I was nervous with it being white, it would show dirty hand/sweat/dirt markings, but so far that has not been the case. So happy I was able to finally get a system and enjoy the new games coming out with the graphics and speed that the game designers envisioned when they made it!

100% worth the purchase. Took me almost a year to procure but I‚Äôm so happy I didn‚Äôt settle. I don‚Äôt know how much faster than the PS4, but it blows it out of the water. It‚Äôs more than a ‚Äúglorified streaming device‚Äù
Signed up for invite. Got invite. PS5 delivered. Dream fulfilled. Worth the wait to just pay retail. The system itself is amazing. Everything I hoped for.

So far am loving it...have had every system except the 4 and never really been disappointed in any of them so far. The only thing have ever had a complaint about is the fact you have to start over buying games everytime other than with the ps2. I think they should make every system, playstation xbox and nintendo where they can play all old system games ESPECIALLY as expensive as games are these days.  It is ridiculous to spend the money on all these games to have to turn around and repurchase the same or newer version when the next system comes out.  That is part of reason never bothered with the ps4, I was tired and could not afford to keep starting over and most times the games I loved like the Breath of Fire series never made it to the newer ones.

I was on the wait-list for quite a long time but it was worth it. My son had a huge smile for his very late birthday gift (maybe early Christmas gift?)! Very quick load times and just a great system. Gran Turismo is very fun, highly recommend it!

The only downside is the controller battery charge duration is equivalent to a 3oz canteen on a July Death Valley survival hike.Bonus:  it does play most (not all) PS4 games, so you don't need to trash all your antique retro games like Anthem.
To be able to play in 4k and more fps. It's definitely a huge upgrade from playing on my PS4 and everything just felt more smooth and felt more in-depth when playing a game like spiderman.
Loved the console, loved the shipping and handling. Amazon is the best for buying and shipping items and this is where I shop at for now on.

review_title: Very happy with the graphics and the controller
review_body: I didn't want to pay some eBay scalper a premium for a PS5, so few months ago I signed up for an "invitation" to buy one from Amazon at retail. I figured I had a slim chance of actually getting a PS5, but I could wait. Fast forward a few months and I was happy to see an invitation from Amazon!I am very glad that I got it. The graphics are the best I've seen and the controller is great! It even has a touch pad and tilt control.The only games I care about are racing simulators. I bought Gran Turismo 7, WRC 10, and Need For Speed Remastered. The PS5 does great with those games except for the latter (which is a PS4 game). It works with the PS5 controller, but not with a steering wheel and pedals. (This is the game developer's issue, not Sony's). But hopefully in a few months they will issue a new version of Need for Speed for the PS5.Anyway, get one of these if you can!

review_body: Fast, powerful, and beautiful. A few quick thoughts as you skim reviews:1. Controller is amazing. As someone who played Xbox exclusively for over ten years, I was skeptical - but I love it. The precision of the force feedback, the speaker/microphone combination, and the adaptive triggers are great fun and contribute to the immersive factor.2. Don‚Äôt sleep on the pre-installed Astro‚Äôs Playground. It‚Äôs been since the pre-N64 years that a console actually came WITH a game. It‚Äôs included. It‚Äôs fun. Play it.3. It‚Äôs laughably huge. As you‚Äôll see if the photo, there was barely enough room in my cabinet for it. I had to alter the cabinet to allow for airflow. Measure and prepare.4. Get an certified HDMI 2.1 cable. Don‚Äôt trust the one it ships with, as I‚Äôve read multiple reports that‚Äôs it‚Äôs not a true 2.1 cable.

review_title: Insane loading time and 10 times quieter than PS4
review_body: This is my best purchase of the year!I've been playing PS for so many years because of its exclusive games. I really enjoy it but the loading time was a bit long recently since the modern game's quality is good. I don't know what type of SSD this PS5 is using but the loading time is insane - most of the time it finishes while you read the text on the screen.With the fast loading time, the console can load the data more than you think - which can give you a way better gaming experience, the graphics are better and the lights and shadows in-game are more realistic.Another thing I have to mention is the noise of the console. If you had a PS4 you know every time you turn it on or start to play, it's just like you playing at the airport - super noisy. PS5 is 10 times quieter! That's a big thing because the noise is really a distraction when you try to play FPS games listening to the footsteps. A huge plus for FPS gamers.There are so many good things to say if you're a gamer. I can only say it's good if you are always a PS guy. I don't own a next-gen XBOX so I'm not sure how that performs, but as a PS player, you will be happy about these. The long time wait was worth it.Talk about the games, PS5 supports previous PS4 games and many of them can be upgraded to the PS5 version for free, the quality and experience were enhanced so enjoy!

PS5 is a nice upgrade over the PS4 for the price. It can play 4K Blu Rays, games at nice FPS and graphics. The controller is a massive upgrade. It feels great buttons are nice. Games load faster as they should considering everything uses SSDs now. There are some software features that I would like to be added like Discord support, better games and app storage management. Hardware wise would like to see to a smaller version for sure.

I still can't believe I was able to get one of these. I was almost beginning to think the PS5 was fake news. It might be a giant monster sitting on the shelf, but the power this thing has is incredible. My controller sucks ass though, it started out as a work of art. But it eats battery power like nothing I've seen before and other people tell me that too. IT went from charging to 2 bars to not charging at all in about 2 weeks.Edit: Hard to say if my controller is damaging my USB C cables or if the console is doing it. My charging issue was fixed with a new cable...but I've had to replace my cable 3 times. The original USB that came with the controller lasted 2 weeks so I used a spare one and it went bad soon after. This last time I bought a comparatively expensive cable to see if this makes a difference in how long it lasts. My PS4's micro USB cable was $4 and lasted 6 years...what gives?

I‚Äôve only had PlayStation consoles since the PS3 slim.  I really liked the PS4 Pro and the PS5 solves the prior gen shortcomings.  Blazing fast SSD performance makes it seem like the old cartridge consoles of yesteryear for loading times.  My biggest complaints are the color, shape, size, and storage capacity.  This thing is BIG.  The color doesn‚Äôt match any other device in my TV stand so it stands out.  Thankfully you can now purchase different color plates but it‚Äôs crappy you have to pay more to make it match.  The curvy design requiring a stand is awkward at best.  Finally the storage capacity is 825 GB rather than a more industry standard 1 TB.  With the OS you‚Äôre only left with 667 GB usable which is used up quickly.  You can run PS4 games from an external drive to save space.  Altogether I still like the console and am excited for Horizon Forbidden West.
The PS5 is worth all the hype, thankfully was able to get my hands on one thanks to Amazon's fair restocking process. This has saved me many times over in the age of quarantining

review_title: A fantastic console and system - worth every penny
review_body: Amazon Purchase and delivery review: I obtained this console through Amazon thanks to @supplyninja on Twitter with the drop, retail price, via Treasure Truck. I suggest everyone follow him. I waited over two months to obtain the console, and it came on time via Amazon. I was very skeptical that Amazon allowed the external box to be delivered in a partially opened condition. With a very close examination of the PS5 box and console, serial numbers matched and the console was not bricked at all.Console review: Having said all of that, this is an AMAZING console. PS Plus has good game deals, PS Now expands the library available to you. The controller is great in hand and I am comfortable playing a game for 6+ hours before the next charge or a break. System storage is large, but these games can fill that up quickly. If you want more storage, get an M.2 and install it internally, as external additional storage can only store PS4 games. review_title: Awesome console, great performance and controller
review_body: The one thing that turned us into PS5 users is the outstanding controllers with variable feedback. It makes such a difference. Also being able to experience the full potential of the controllers with Astro's Playroom is great family fun. Completely satisfied, the console supports most of the popular streaming apps and doubles as a blu-ray DVD player. Would buy again. The one thing that Xbox X has going for it is that it is a complete media station, with a lot of connections and outputs for audio and video. It also seems to have a lot of games available for it. Playstation seems minimal in comparison but does well for pure performance.

review_title: A little pricey, but it's the latest and greatest from Sony.
review_body: I was one of the lucky ones to get my hands on the PS5 this year. After struggling to get my hands on one, here we are.First off, this thing is big. It's not too big to where it takes up all real estate, but it is also oddly shaped. Looks very cool, but practical? Rectangular would help when it comes to placement. Setup was very straightforward.I am coming from the PS4, so I was expecting the interface to be the same. There are some slight changes that make it fresh, but all in all it didn't feel confusing.When playing a game, you can definitely see a difference. On the PS4, character hair seemed stuck in clumps, while the 5 is a bit more flowy(is that a word?). It appears more crisp, but maybe thats just me.I gave it 4 stars because these things are hard to get. Prepare for sleepless nights on your quest to get one.

review_title: Was so excited to get for my son!
review_body: Like a lot of other people, I‚Äôd been trying for months to secure this console. Son has PS4 but wanted to upgrade. I joined rewards programs for other places, started following a few guys on Twitter to learn about drops, and basically became obsessed with all things PS5. Turns out only thing I needed was my Prime membership and knowledge of when the drops happen. Was able to get the item before Christmas and keep son in the dark literally until he started opening. He loves the console and plays whenever he gets the chance.

review_title: It is a great machine; wish it had more SSD storage.
review_body: Gaming PCs provide the best experience for next-gen or cutting edge gaming, but it isn‚Äôt affordable for the majority of families. This console provides a great gaming experience  at a relatively affordable price. The loading times from the SSD is unbelievable and the DualSense controller is so comfortable and makes the games that utilize its features more immersive. Even though it‚Äôs a 5-star review for me, I don‚Äôt particularly like that the built-in storage is not enough if your gaming rotation is more than 4 games. I understand that this probably kept the console price down, but the small SSD limits how awesome this console could be.

The reason why it's only a 4 star is because the console is impossible to come by.  It took me the longest of time to get it.  Also, the packaging was sub-par.  It didn't have a lot of brown paper or peanuts for the console.  It  could've been easily damaged.  Thankfully, mine came in alright, but still, for a $500 product, I expected better.

Got our first console through the Sony invite, no problems whatsoever.  Then I got another invite from Amazon and we pounced on it so the wife could upgrade her PS4.  Right out of the box the new one would stop pairing with the controller within a minute of startup! We never even got to finish the updates, as we can't use the controller after the first couple commands work fine.  Spent way too much time on the phone with Amazon, who in the end could only offer a refund.  No replacement!  Upon going to the Sony page, they will take it for repair, but "expect extended delay for return."  Screw it, at this point we'll get our money back and wait again for another chance.  I sincerely hope you have better luck than we did, but at least the first one still works!  BTW,  I found online this pairing issue seems pretty common, although NO fix offered resolved the problem with ours. Good luck!

review_title: Best Gaming Console on the Market!
review_body: The system is fast, quiet, and graphics look incredible on my 65 inch Samsung 4K QLED. So happy I was finally able to snag one.
Sony does it again! Best console on the market!

Update 2: controller ergonomics are pretty bad. It's the most cluttered controller I've used and due to smaller hands I have a hard time reaching buttons near the center of the controller. Not to mention that the triggers are actually painful to use. Several areas have sharp corners that dig into the fingers after short use, compounded by the high force of the trigger haptics. Gaming shouldn't be painful.Update: after another week of use, reconfirming all the below with the added issues of unhideable menu elements spoiling games (progress cards) I just started, and a HORRIBLE controller battery life with no replaceable battery save for disassembling the controller. Unacceptable.The PS5 in one word: ClutteredHaving been a multi console household for the better part of the last 20 years this is probably one of the most disappointing showings when compared to the other options out there (PC/Xbox/Steam Deck). Very few compelling exclusives, especially given that some 'exclusives' will also be on PC, considerably less accessibility forethought in nearly every aspect of the controller and UI, visually cluttered and unintuitive navigation in the basic menus, the game overlays are very visually noisy and do not duck game audio, virtually no visual customization or organization options, lights up my whole room if I want to charge a controller with no options to disable lights. It feels like every feature they could think of was added to make the core experience harder to navigate with nobody stopping to ask, do people want this? It's just not a good looking console either.In short, I regret buying this console. And until it gets some serious usability updates (unlikely given it's already a two year old console) I can't recommend it.

The Playstation 5 is a leap forward for console gaming, they have a gorgeous 4K performance feature, faster loading times than the last gen consoles and a well redefined controller that makes playing games more immersive and enjoyable. The best part is that It plays nearly all PS4 games, and it allows them to run and load better than ever before. I'm looking forward to more games releasing at the end of this year. My overall review is a 5/5.

review_title: DO NOT BUY A PS5 FROM AMAZON
review_body: A little while ago I purchased a ps5 on Amazon when they were in stock and I was really excited since it‚Äôs been in short supply for a while now. When it arrived I noticed that the box had been dented but I didn‚Äôt think anything of it at first. After about 1 day of use the disc drive had stopped working altogether, disks wouldn‚Äôt eject so I found out that you can manually eject them if you open up the back of the console, however the problem was actually that the laser wasn‚Äôt working. I tried to contact support for this without any luck, knowing that the chances of getting a replacement was slim to none. Luckily I was able to purchase a new one through Sony this past week and my unboxing experience was significantly different. When I received the new device the box had a reflective sticker on it that they use to tamper-proof their boxes. So in short if you buy a PS5, even if it‚Äôs directly SOLD and SHIPPED from Amazon and you do not see this sticker save yourself the trouble and return it immediately and get your money back.

review_title: One of Sony's best consoles to date...
review_body: I want to start this by saying I got my PS5 on launch through Sony directly. I was lucky enough to get one on pre-order. So everything I'm saying is from MY experience with the console and based on facts and not either lying about something or being salty because "I didn't get one" so I make up things I've heard.First STOP blaming Sony for the shortage, same with blaming Microsoft for their shortage. It's due to component shortage which all stems from the pandemic (Covid-19). You want more consoles then do the following: 1) Get vaccinated. 2) Wear a mask. 3) STOP going to large gatherings.....Secondly, if you want scalpers to stop "stealing" consoles or really anything then stop buying stuff from them. If there is no one buying from them then there is no profit for them to scalp highly sought after items. It's as simple as that, yet people still throw $1,000's of dollars at these things because they have to have it now..which keeps these people in business and they'll do it until it's no longer viable.Third, yes I agree Sony dropped the ball hardcore on storage in a few ways. First 860gbish w/ 600gbish of actual usable space was not the best idea there. I can't say if that was a design choice or due to larger drive shortages and/or cost. Secondly they dropped the ball on making the storage soldered to the motherboard preventing anyone from replacing it if it goes bad. As far as I know currently the M.2 slot is not usable as primary storage if the board one fails. Now as for some people saying you can only store 5 games on their drive are in my opinion lying about that. On my console I had the following installed just fine:Spiderman MMAssassins Creed ValhallaCall of Duty Cold War (Campaign, Multiplayer & zombies)Watchdogs LegionBugsnaxAstros PlayroomDemon SoulsAlong with that the people saying it costs $500 for additional storage again are either misinformed or lying for whatever reasons. For a 1tb M2 drive that works on the PS5 the MOST out of pocket you'd pay is between $250 & $300. Unless you opt for the version without a heatsink and buy a 3rd party heatsink and save some money. Is that overpriced? Yes it is by A LOT. But again THERE IS A SHORTAGE currently, not to mention importing has been a nightmare. Expect paying more right now, it's the state of things all over the world.Third, is this a true next-gen console? Honestly that is a matter of perspective, is the PS5 or Xbox series X currently being used to their max? No not even close, part of the reason is the previous gen consoles are still alive and kicking so Sony & Microsoft are still supporting those consoles. Will we see the power the PS5 can actually do any time soon? Again probably not, at least not for another couple of years. Part of the reason and actually the main one is console shortage. Until there is a steady stream of next-gen consoles available developers will continue to support both last gen and current gen consoles because that is how they sell their games and make money. I like a lot of gamers don't like that but it is how things are and I understand that like most normal people do.Lastly, the argument a lot of people have....Which is better PS5/Xbox/PC/Switch? In reality none are better than the other. Play whichever you like, I opted to hold off on the Xbox Series X simply because there weren't enough exclusive titles to make the purchase reasonable for me. But to be blunt, basing it all on power/storage/graphics is futile. I still power up my NES and play that from time to time. The whole point of a game console is to play games and have fun, don't get hung up on specs. Focus on what games you want to play and go that route. Enjoy yourself, play online and make new friends (just don't be toxic....there is no need for that). Video games are meant to be fun, arguing on which is better just ruins it for everyone.So to recap. Console shortage is due to pandemic and part shortage, impatient people keep scalpers in business, storage will always be an issue regardless of times or console, and play whatever makes you happy and don't let people shame you for what you love.

review_title: Great console had it day 1, Nov 12, 2020
review_body: Great console, had since launch day, Nov 2020.ha-ha to the dweebs that still don't have one! I hope you never get one,  and that reseller prices continue to increase beyond reach.

The playstation 5 or also known as the PS5 is an upgraded version of the playstation 4. With this new console instead of playing games at 30fps now with the PS5 you can play games up to 120fps only if your tv supports it. It has a usb c charger to charge your dualshock controller for the PS5. With this charger it allows you to charge your controller at a way faster rate. Another thing is that it has triffect effects that react with the game to make it feel more realistic.My experience with this product is amazing. With this product it runs insanely fast just like a pc. It runs way faster than any console I have ever used. I also tend to play spiderman which is a game that can only be played on the ps4 or ps5 which is really fun. With the ps5 it makes you feel like you're actually inside of the game.  I love the feeling around playing spiderman and the feel of the controller just feels amazing. I have had this product for almost 2 years now and I have ot had a single problem with this product yet! I very much recommend this product.The  Pros of the product is that if you have playstation 4 disk games and you plan on throwing them away because you think you can‚Äôt play them anymore well, with the console you are able to put in the Ps4 disk inside of the ps5 and use them. One thing about this product is that it has different modes you can turn it into. You can put it in rest mode and then the Ps5 will light up a bright orange color, doing this allows you to keep your place in a game mode you were in. You can also power off your ps5 if you don‚Äôt want that option, and the other option was that you could simply restart your ps5. When you Ps5 you will have a bright blue led light that lets you know it's on.One con of this product is that if your tv isn‚Äôt that good you won‚Äôt be able to see it for the full experience. You can play games but some games only allow you to play ps4 games only on the ps4. Some games that you play might be taken away because the deal with that company stopped.Also from time to time the controller will have stick drift which is very annoying. The trigger effects if not used right can break your controller if you press down too hard.In conclusion I would give this product a 9 out of 10. The reason why I say this is because everything is amazing but some features shouldn't be able to break a controller you bought and then you have to pay more money for a new one. Overall I love the 120 fps feature which is amazing and I never expected it to be possible with a console! If you buy this product make sure you have all the features you need like tv I would suggest a 144hz monitor or a 4k tv. OTher than that the product is really well built.

As a gamer of about 30 years (I started young), I've had almost every console throughout the generations. Obviously, things get better with time (graphics, loading time, design, games, etc.). The PS5 is a real leap forward in so many ways. It was hard to envision how the PS5 was going to be better than PS4 (knowing we're reaching graphical thresholds). I think games like Horizon, Returnal, Demon's Souls remake, Ratchet and Clank, and others have really showed the pure power of this system. The load times alone were worth the upgrade for me, and although we're slow to start in this generation, as well keep PS4 in mind, I think within the next year, as God of War , Forspoken, and others arrive, we will start seeing the real potential of this machine.To the 1-star reviewers talking about shipment and stock issues - that is not a review of the console and should be taken down by Amazon.

I love it so much. Best console hands down in a good while

I finally got one of these, but within an hour of use I realized I would have to return it as I could not tolerate the loud high pitch wavering ufo like noise coming from the fan. It wasn‚Äôt coil whine as it was a different type of noise, and it also did not make the noise in sleep mode. I have owned a fat ps2 and a launch ps4 as well as various other consoles and pcs over the years so it‚Äôs not like I went in expecting silence. Like the fan noise of the ps4 might be louder in decibels than the ps5, but the high pitch frequency of the ps5 makes it totally unlivable to me. It was actually painful being in the same room with it even when it was doing nothing but sitting on the Home Screen.When I looked into it I found out that Sony uses 3 different types of fans in the ps5, and the brand that I got is known for making the high pitch ufo noise. The ps5 is still scarce even though it‚Äôs been out for 2 years already, and possibly 1/3rd of them are manufactured with the ‚Äúbad‚Äù fan type. So I chose to get an Xbox instead of going through the hassle of returning systems until I could find one with one of the other two brands of fan that doesn‚Äôt make the ufo noise.Pretty disappointed in the lack of quality/care coming from Sony. It‚Äôs a perfectly nice console if you either get lucky and get one of the quiet ones, or are not sensitive to high pitch noises.

After 2 long years of waiting I finally got my mitts on a PS5 and all I can say is meh.I've had every Playstation console ever made (yeah I'm extremely extremely wealthy what of it???) and this is by far the least exciting of all of them.  Here are my 1st impressions of each console1. PS1: disc's? What kind of wizardry is this??? This thing is awesome! Somebody give me a surge and a pack of gushers, time to celebrate!2. PS2: whoa the graphics rule, way better than that wack a** PS1! Give me a Faygo, time ro celebrate (this was during my juggalo phase)3. PS3: the graphical improvements keep on a'comin!! Give me a 40oz, time to celebrate (this was during my raging alcoholic phase)!!!4. PS4: will it ever end, how do these consoles keep blowing away the previous ones??? Give me a bag full of drugs, time to celebrate (I was having some personal issues at the time, but the PS4 was the entertainment intervention I needed)!!!5. PS5: this is it? I can barely tell the difference.  This literally looks exactly like PS4 graphics.  Somebody give me an ensure, I no longer have the will to live.So there you go. The PS5 is such a disappointment.  This did not justify being a whole new console or a $500 price tag. This should have been called the PS4.2 or something.  It's a slight tiny improvement over the last version.  Seriously they should have made it some kind of siamese add-on like the sega-cd or Sega Saturn back in the day. Too young to remember that you gen z punk? Well let me put it in language you can understand no cap on god that mf'er was not bussin fr..Why is the PS5 such a joke?  Let me count the ways. Five is in the name so it's 5 reasons I give1. The graphics: I'm not even sure they are any better. People tell me they are so I guess my own ocular receptacles must be filthy liars. Looks exactly the same to me. And before you get your panties in a wad, yes I'm playing on a 4k TV and all that sh**. Settle down nerd.2. The console size: When I say this thing is huge, I mean this thing is huge. You could hollow one out and house a homeless dude inside.  Why would you want to do that? Good question...you wouldn't.  The homeless can't be trusted but neither can Sony.Can't be trusted with designing a console that isn't big enough for a homeless man to....oh wait I already went thru that. Seriously though there is a homeless man who hangs around outside my house all day and it's got me all in a tizzy, apologies.3. The wait: If I got this thing day 1 then my disappointment still would have been immense, but not this epic.4. The price: ok the price was pretty standard for a new console but I'm running out of ideas and feel like I shouldn't have promised 5 criticisms.5. The homeless man living outside my house:  was he drawn here by the hypnotizing glow of the PS5 thru the window? It's possible.  Unlikely, but still possible.So yeah.  Five solid reasons why you should avoid this thing like the plague. Just wait for the PS6. Which I'm sure will blow too. Dm me for 6 reasons why...

review_title: Great Console.  Infuriating customer support.  De facto ransomware.
review_body: All the great things about this console are well-established.  I will tell you a few things that might give you pause. 1) Something random went wrong with my console, and it now boots to a safe mode menu with every option greyed out except "Reset PS5 (Reinstall System Software)."  I tried contacting PS Support through chat.  Once I was finally connected with an agent, the agent immediately closed the chat, before interacting with me in any way.  I tried to go to chat again, and received a message that said "Hey there, back so soon?, it seems Chat has not been of help to you, please try again tomorrow."2) As of launch, there was no way to backup saves to usb, they had to be put in the cloud, using PS Plus.  For people who don't care for multiplayer, and prefer to choose their own games rather than playing whatever PS Plus decides to "give away for free," PS Plus is a poor value.  It amounts to an insurance system for protecting your own (save) data, that over the course of a console cycle, costs as much as actually paying to retrieve your PC data from a ransomware user.  XBOX and PC, I am given to understand, allow cloud saves without payment.I'm not one to cut off my nose to spite my face, and Sony has some great exclusives.  But I'll think twice about buying third party games from their storefront in the future.
Best gaming console to date
Love my PS5 one of the best consoles I've owned!!!!

review_title: Great new addition to the family
review_body: I was one of the lucky few who received an invitation from PlayStation Network to buy a PS5 and have it delivered on the release date. Since I received the PS5 it has consistently been put to use and I haven‚Äôt noticed any factory bugs as of yet. I have enjoyed the PS5 since then and have great things to say in regards to the total experience. Now, it isn‚Äôt all a basket of roses and I‚Äôll get to that later in the review. My first impression of the console was the design was lackluster, however it quickly grew on me. Especially with the new additions of the customizable shells in various colors. My favorite feature of the new PS5 is the controller with haptic feedback. This is a great feature with a lot of potential which hasn‚Äôt been fully realized yet by game developers. The new user interface took some getting used to but I enjoy the appearance and layout more than the PS4. The GPU and RAM are very comparable to its biggest competitor. I mainly play on the performance setting combined with a TV that has a high enough refresh rate to keep up. This has proven to be a marked upgrade from the previous console and will only get better as game developers start to utilize the full potential. The area where this falters is in the hard drive which is lacking in size at around 700 gigabytes of usable space. I‚Äôve found this to fill up much too quickly. In this day and age it should have been too costly for Sony to add a bigger hard drive. Another issue with this console is scarcity and the difficulty some are having to get their hands on one. Scalpers using bots have also made this issue an even bigger problem with inflated prices. The last issue which is possible but hasn‚Äôt been fully realized yet is Microsoft buying up some of the best and biggest game studios. Sony does have some good console exclusives but Microsoft has the ability to now make some of the very best games into Microsoft exclusives. All in all I would recommend this console to those who can get their hands on one.

1) It's slow.2) Disc's sound like a jet engine running.3) Runs out of space. I had more on my PS4 with the exact terabyte size drive. I have to delete games to make more room.4) Trying to upload game saves and/or moves saves to an external hard drive. Takes almost 10 to 15 minutes. My PS4 would do saves in both places in under 2 minutes. No more trying to save and run out the door. BECAUSE I'M WAITING. They make you believe that PS5 is so much quicker.

I was one of the lucky ones to get this the first month and have had it since and here are my thoughts.Pros: I only had the base PS4 since 2014 and is a major upgrade in terms of loading times, menu access, and free PS5 upgrades from PS4 games ( depending on the company and game ) so that's mainly 60 FPS (Frames Per Second).It is easier to clean the PS5, The system is super quiet compared to the fan of a PS4.The UI interface is a major upgrade making it easier to access apps, settings, games, etc.Cons:The controller is amazing but the adaptive triggers have a flimsy coil that will break if you put too much pressure on it, mine's been broke 2 months after use and a new one is $69 or send it in and wait a couple weeks. It also has a major drift problem where it aims in a certain direction because of it's dated hardware and is frustrating, especially if you play multiplayer games. I had the PS4 controller since launch and never had any problem with it and I have problems with the new controllers and took 2 months for problems to occur.In short, flimsy hardware for an advanced controller.Storage is little compared to the games made today. it is 667 GB and that's small if you have a big collection of PS4 and PS5 games. Mind you games like Call of Duty is 200 GB. Luckily there is a storage upgrade but it can range a couple hundred dollars so that's based on your preference.The PS5 is worth buying but not for the price above $500 and I hope everyone will be able to get there hands on one of these soon.

Although the PlayStation 5 is a fantastic console, there are some aspects that the Xbox Series X may have the upper hand. The PlayStation is equipped with about 680 gigabytes of useable storage for users. On the other hand, the Xbox comes standard with a 1 terabyte SSD allowing for more storage for games and apps instead of having to decide which games you need to delete to download a new game.Sony has taken this flaw into account. They have included an internal SSD port into the console for users to expand storage. Some SSD cards can get pricy though ranging from 100-800 dollars depending on the storage size and speed of the card. Sony was able to make the flaw of less storage and be able to make the console even better because most SSD cards while adding storage also increase download speeds, which on the PS5 is already fast.

I‚Äôve had my PS5 since release & I can confidently tell you it‚Äôs worth the price. I personally never had a PS4 last generation so this was definitely a nice change. review_title: Over a year waiting and here it is!
review_body: When I look at its mesmerizing cardboard exterior, I can think only of the endless joy it contains. Behind the layers of pressed paper printed with a most welcoming and stunning photo, lays a machine of pure beauty. A vessel of performance. Engineered perfection encased in plastic and styrofoam. As my hands grasp the box, I feel only the radiation of processing power only a PlayStation 5 can emit. Only when I hold the console, do all my worries, fears and stresses leave my mind, and are cast aside to leave infinite space for the countless memories that will soon fill every region of my brain. I can only hope that I find the will power to avert my gaze from the TV screen, only just long enough to sip a mountain dew as to not miss any moment in the presence of this glorious console and the brilliantly crafted games that will soon fill its hard drive. I may not sleep. I may not eat. I may never leave this house. May God have mercy on my soul.

So obviously I got the ps5 for myself and it is a fantastic machine.  Awesome games, great features, reasonably priced etc etc.  but it shines most for me is with one of my little girls.  She suffers from autism and many things we take for granted she struggles with.  The relevant thing here being her fine motor skills.  The ps5 has a pack-in game called Astro‚Äôs playroom and my little one adores it.  She can barely speak but I often get a ‚ÄúI want playroom‚Äù from her and it‚Äôs a little miracle as this game is designed to show off the new controller, but since she loves the game, it actually gets her to use and develop those fine motor skills.  She‚Äôs using the touchpad, tilting the controller left or right, learning pressure sensitivity with the buttons, just a plethora of things that‚Äôs exponentially increasing the tool set she has to become more independent.  Even her therapist has commented on how great a help it has been.Thank you Sony.

It took me two years to get a ps5, which I finally obtained directly from Sony through an invitation only program.  Less than a week later, it was already refusing to turn on and/or connect to my Sony Bravia tv.  The troubleshooting process is worse than useless, as the console only communicates through lights on the chassis, and my typical pattern ‚Äî blue, flashing white, solid white, orange, nothing ‚Äî doesn‚Äôt even appear in the user manual.  Rebuilding the database, safe mode, none of them did a thing.  This is a $500 machine that is less reliable and much uglier than my $20 alarm clock.  The chassis even feels cheap, like a poorly designed blender.  I own every PlayStation all the way back to the PS1, and all of them still work great to this day ‚Äî except the one I got last week.  Sony support is also useless, and tried to connect me to another PlayStation user to talk about my problem ‚Äî a non employee!  The entire thing feels like a scam, and I have lost a huge amount of respect and goodwill for this company.  They have no idea what they are doing, and no plans to figure it out.

review_title: This is partly a review of the PS5 as a console, but a 1-star ding on retail ineptitude.
review_body: First, the PS5 gets a 4-star review from me, I was able to play a unit from one of those lucky family members that spend 24/7 clicking reload once per minute during restock announcements.  It is unarguably the best current generation.  The raw CPU and GPU performance are very noticeable, but it a decent internal sub-storage unit with more capacity would've been a win.  Sadly, the library has yet to grow to a point to make it a considerable investment.  It was good of many development houses to provide "free" upgrades to many PS4 generation games, but I'm hoping to see new offerings of the heavy hitting IPs on the console.On that note, the ONE STAR is handed to the business practices of the online retail market.  You are not protecting consumers enough and allow shady scalpers to sweep the stock using bots and then reselling for obscenely inflated prices.  These same scalpers use Amazon's lenient return policy to ensure that they don't lose any money, and then re-buy the same units for retail price once again.  Scalping isn't illegal, but it's morally ambiguous.  I will wait for as long as necessary to get a unit at the retail price.
Finally able to got one for my little brother. Thanks amazon

After a little over one year I received an email invite from Sony Direct to purchase the PS5 Console. You are given 72 hours to respond to the invite via a link in your email where you'll be given a time and date to make your purchase. Read the instructions carefully as any mistake can cancel your opportunity to complete your order. When shipped you will be given a tracking number; my came via "Federal Express" and required a signature upon delivery.  Sony released a modified or new PS5 model: CFI-1115A. The revision was given the designation CFI-1115A, while the previous model runs under the designation CFI-1015A. NOTE: The PS5 can not be warranty registered on line but is automatically registered when added to your PlayStation Management Account. Only reason for my low rating is Sony's poor handling of the initial release

I have had my Playstation 5 since release and not only have technical issues with it, there is some faulty design issues.Issue 1: If you use the PS5 controller wirelessly there is severe input lag and connection is interupted if you are using wifi nearby.Issue 2: Plugging in the PS5 Controller with the usb cord to use the controller wired causes issue with the USB-C port and causes the controller to consistently disconnect making you struggle to get the controller to reconnect mid-gameIssue 3: Have already had to send the PS5 out for nearly 4 weeks to repair the HDMI port because it's poor quality. Only unplugged and replugged in the hdmi cord twice and was very careful.Issue 3: Frequent issues the games becoming corrupted causing to have to be completely uninstalled, reinstalled and still may not help. currently performing a factory reset because have had to redownload all of my games multple times without resolve. You can only redownload an 90GB game before you are extremely aggravated.Issue 4: Controller headphone ports are fragile. I accidently put maybe 2-3lb of pressure on the headphone jack and completely broke the port. Cheap plastic.Issue 5: Consistent Issue with Adapataive triggers. Some games work well, and some games make it completely obnoxious to play. I have had to turn off this feature in multiple games because of poor optimization.Issue 6: Controller Vibtations cause audible sounds from inside the controller and sometimes don't work as intended and consistently vibrate unless you turn the controller off completely.Likely my last Playstation product and will switching over to Microsoft Series X soon.

You'll only have 2 years on it before Sony unveils PS6 by 2026.Meanwhile us PC master race will be on a new RTX, 4K Graphics as a standard on all games and better optimized components for faster and reliable fps.Just get a PC, scalpers already want you to drop a Grand on a PS5...

review_title: Nothing like generating demand for something you can serve the market with
review_body: At this point, when will they start taking pre-orders for the PS6?  What a complete and total joke of a launch of a product and frankly if I was a game developer, I'd stay away from building games for this nonsense.  What's the point of generating mass demand for the sake of hype when there's no distribution for the hardware product?  Seems to me a well funded competitor could TAKE this market if they could meet the demand of the consumer.  Perhaps SAMSUNG or Apple (God forbid, I cannot believe I even used the latter in a sentence) could easily take this market over, and quick.

Technical issues. Cheap ware. Lackluster vision. Capitalist greed. There‚Äôs no significant improvement in this minus the speed of the system.The system is plagued with bugs, overheating issues. The controllers are even worse and the analog will stop working sooner than you know. Do not buy either this or the XboxOne

The console is amazing, the retail experience when trying to purchase a console.I don‚Äôt blame Sony as so many others, instead I directly blame Amazon. Literally every other retailer has placed a limit on the number of consoles you can buy, including the manufacturer. Not Amazon, they could care less if Johnny Bot boy buys all of them, then to make matters worse, Amazon allows Johnny to take said consoles and list them on their site for 2-3x the retail price. Not to mention letting people swipe items from your cart before you have the chance to checkout.Amazon used to be great when they were still growing. Now that they dominate the market they seem to care less about the consumer and more about the revenue.

The fact that it is actually pretty hard to get your hands on one for the original selling price still to this day blows my mind. I refuse to pay $200+ to someone who sits around waiting for them to drop, buys multiple and then flips it for a quick dollar. The ps5 is honestly hyped up more than what it really is. The controllers are well known to get stick drift & bad charging within the first 1.5 years of using it. And to replace the controller with a new one is expensive. There's very limited games for the ps5 alone (to have the full ps5 experience) and the headphones are trash. They hurt your head/ears after awhile and will break over time. Period. It's really sad to see people fighting and upselling this console bc Sony only puts out a limited amount every so often. If you look at the gross amount of PS consoles sold over the years starting from the very first one made, the ps5 doesn't even scratch the surface of the amount made/sold. Why create something for the masses but only have very few. I have so many thoughts on this. Bottom line, Sony needs to either make a wait list and sell only to those people directly or produce enough for everyone in demand. Terrible

review_title: Block an account based on your nation
review_body: I was born in Russia, but I have not lived in Russia for a long time.  In my account, Sonya indicated that I was Russian.  With the outbreak of the war between Russia and Ukraine, Sony unilaterally blocked my account because I am Russian.  This was done simply on the basis of my nationality.  I tried to change the account region through those support, to which Sony replied that they would not do this and left my account blocked.  Keep in mind when buying this console that the company can afford to block your account simply because you are of the wrong nation.

First let me say the bad jokesüòÄ. When I first held it, I said what the heck is this? Is it an encyclopedia britanica? Is it a chopping block or giant cutting board? Is it a giant bible?From the design alone I love the PS5 Disc Model. When I look at it, I feel like I have a carefully designed trophy in my room. It looks so technically advanced including the controller. The UI, home page music, navigating the menus, everything is so smooth. It doesn‚Äôt get loud. Setting up the PS5 is a breeze and not long.The 2TB memory expansion is a must-have. Let me say if SONY had of added a 2TB SSD, the PS5 would have easily cost around $650 to $700 probably. These memory expansions are not cheap but very worth it. Also adding the memory expansion is a breeze. I much rather have the memory expansion securely enclosed instead of sticking out where it can get damaged.The first game I bought? You guessed it. FFVII REMAKE INTERMISSION PS5 version. This reminds of the first time I bought a PS and FFVII. Now history is repeating itself. I ABSOLUTELY WANT THE FFVII REMAKE PARTS 2,3, and 4 üëç. From the first mission to the first battle in chapter 1, I was hooked. And lost track of time.I‚Äôm looking forward to the future games and life of the PS5. I hope SONY treats the PS5 well. The PS5 could be a huge success.

review_title: Next Gen Console a love letter to the customers
review_body: To be clear Xbox Series S is next gen! it can game in 4K & play games at 120 FPS !!For parents to help out if buying for kidsXbox one S is previous gen! Note it says Xbox ‚Äúone‚Äù S. Some previous gen Xbox consoles have ‚Äúone‚Äù in the name.  It‚Äôs Xbox, Xbox 360, Xbox One, now Xbox Series X/S.The newest generation of Xbox consoles all have ‚ÄúSeries‚Äù X or S in the name.Series X is the black bigger consoleSeries S is the white smaller consoleThe Xbox Series S‚Ä¶. It‚Äôs small, takes up little space and is powerful. The Series S can out preform the Series X in some departments like keeping 60 frames per second during challenging experiences for the console to run. The Series X wins in little things like draw distances and seeing a slightly better resolution, but at times could drop the frame rate. But they are pretty much the same next gen experience just two options for customers. What‚Äôs the biggest difference?Microsoft made a way for players not to miss out on next gen experience due to not being able to afford it! If you want next gen and also to save some money the Series S was made for you!! But if you want the full experience the Series X was made for you!! Series X wins for storage but Series S can allow 20 or more decent sized games plus don‚Äôt forget you can use cloud gaming for a lot of games you don‚Äôt want to download.Game pass cloud feature you can play games within seconds not having to download / install anything.I‚Äôve tested the Series X and Series S and it‚Äôs barley a difference. I‚Äôm able to pick up and resume my save data from Series X to Series S no problem. Gears of war 5 or WWE 2k22 for example are just about the same on both.Series X - more storage, physical games CAN be played. Slightly better resolution. Loading time differences are to be within seconds nothing wild to report.Series S - Digital only! Meaning no physical games can be played. WiFi is required to set up and download games. Once it‚Äôs fully updated and games are downloaded it can be used offline but WiFi is needed to first set up the console and download games!!Series S should not be put down or downplayed, more information should be out there to help customers know this is truly next gen. The Series S is easier to find and it‚Äôs nothing wrong with it.Example of storage. Series S. Currently have6 Xbox series X/S optimized games installed, 9 Xbox one games installed,3 Xbox 360 games installed1 Xbox (original console) game installed.Still have 52 GB free !!Downloading my library from Xbox one (previous generation Xbox) to Series S was super easy via the Xbox app. (Available on Google play android and iOS App Store) Much easier than Sony PlayStation has been. Xbox wants you to keep your library and keeps giving added backwards compatibility! I‚Äôm so happy with my Series S and don‚Äôt even care about the Series X anymore. It‚Äôs the same thing to me with little differences that aren‚Äôt worth the price difference. And not to every gamer it will be worth the price difference.  The loading and quick resume give new life into last gen games that had long loading times ! Something like UFC 4 gets a lovely FPS boost along with Far Cry 5 and many others. Games you‚Äôve already paid for are upgraded and new games will slowly unlock the true power of your purchase. You won‚Äôt be needing to trade the Series S in for an upgrade because it will be able to run the new titles and keep up just fine!It‚Äôs even small enough for different delivery options ! I got my Xbox delivered to a local stores locker ! It was super light to carry and didn‚Äôt come in a box revealing what‚Äôs inside thankfully.If you deeply care about 4 to 5 extra bushes and a pinch more draw distance that doesn‚Äôt make a difference to the degree that you wouldn‚Äôt be able to react. Like a driving game you‚Äôll be able to have the same experience on both consoles same game just the series x might have slightly more available to see in the distance.  If storage is that important to y‚Äôall  or resolution go with the X. But if you want next gen and don‚Äôt need the extra storage, don‚Äôt care about physical games, and want to save money go with the Series S.Don‚Äôt miss out on next gen waiting out for the normal priced Series X if the S is available.This review is to help others understand the difference between the many names of Xbox consoles and see if the Series S is the best option. If not some information about the Xbox Series X is in my review to help to decide. Also to help parents out to make the right purchase for a potential surprise gift!Reviews are always designed to help out others and I hope it has been clear to help out others!!!

review_title: I had lost interest in videogames until now
review_body: When I was a little kid, I used to play videogames everyday either in my computer on in my 16 bit console. Yeah it was a long time ago. As I grew up and life became harder for me, I always said "I have no time to play", "consoles are too expensive and I am not a pro". So when series S launched I looked at the reasonable price and thought to give it a try, along with the Game pass . I bought it, plugged it and played! I didn't even need to redecorate because it's small. There are some OEM batteries for the control included so you can use it very quickly after initial setup. I have played the most unconventional games and the mainstream ones too. I have played hockey games, various simulators... And the most important of all: I can forget my everyday problems as soon as I sit down and play in this white marvel. I am playing videogames again!

review_title: Plenty of power and very compact!
review_body: To start, I purchased this for my wife while I myself got the series X. Only because I do much more gaming and thought I‚Äôd need the better system‚Ä¶boy was I wrong. This little console appears to pack as much punch as my series X. I honestly couldn‚Äôt tell a difference when running the same game. The graphics are great and so is the load times. I personally sold my series X and got one of these. Due to it‚Äôs small stature it fit my setup way better than the bulkier series X. Other than the HDD being smaller there wasn‚Äôt any reason in my opinion to have the series X when this worked just as well. Again this is my opinion. I definitely recommend getting the series S if you‚Äôre interested in a new gen console.

Comes with a controller, thankfully, as well. Though, you will need batteries or a new gen usb cable or purchase a separate controller battery charging station setup, but I digress. this product is amazing, don‚Äôt listen to the dummies who say ‚Äúit doesn‚Äôt work‚Äù or ‚Äúmy screen doesn‚Äôt work now‚Äù all you need to do is use your heads. the monitor closes on the fan right? and usually it‚Äôs fairly warm, right? look you can say what you want but i wait till the xbox is cooled down then i close the monitor. that‚Äôs the only flaw of this product. it‚Äôs 100% worth it if you have a brain.

I've had an Xbox One for years, and it was time for an upgrade.  While the Xbox Series X, and PS5 are impossible to find (or being sold by bottom feeding scalpers), I figured I'd try out the series S.  It's worked great, and the picture quality is awesome. I'm guessing they prioritized profit over functionality, but you can buy a separate storage drive if needed (still pricey).  Overall a good system, minus the storage space.

review_title: No Disc no DVD Slot Xbox BUT That‚Äôs No scratched up Discs!
review_body: This was bought night for myself, but for my fianc√© and his son to play with over the summer. So far so good has excellent graphics card design to it, I like the fact that the fan is on the top or side depending on how you place it as opposed to the Xbox 360 which had a lot of fan issues for overheating. No overheating issues. However I do wanna make it clear that this option Xbox S Series IS an Xbox One BUT does NOT have a slot for game discs and you cannot play DVDs or Blu-ray is on it. So if you‚Äôre looking to buy a line for your children to share their disc games on this is not the option for you. However if you‚Äôre looking for one that the kids can‚Äôt scratch the games up on this is definitely the option for you as it is all download it to the Xbox or you can keep it in the cloud to play.

review_title: Great Xbox for those with 1080p and GamePass Ultimate
review_body: The Series X is the better value, but the Series S is the cheaper of the two, especially with the various sales and used options floating around.  It‚Äôs small, silent, stylish, and good enough for anyone with a 1080p TV who wants to experience current Gen Xbox games. Would def recommend it as an upgrade to anyone on an Xbox One or Xbox 360. Games load very fast. Graphics are slightly better than those on the Xbox One.The only downside is that it has 375GB of available space. With some AAA games coming in at 120GB+ you may find your self juggling SSD space for keep more than a handful of games installed. You can use an external drive to run Xbox One and Xbox 360 games, but not Xbox Series S | X games. An official Xbox storage card can support S | X but it costs so much your probably better off getting a Series X at the start.

This thing is definitely worth the money! Load up speed is great, doesn‚Äôt get hot fast and looks great on 4k tvs and high resolution monitors. Just be aware of the space! Get an external! As you should anyways, but it is really useful for this system because of it being all digital!
This console is awesome
It's what I expected...

I bought this Xbox to give to my friend as a birthday present, and honestly?? It's been a lot of fun. They absolutely love it, and it's a nice small addition to their room, and both of our free times. Good things come in little packages, seriously!! It doesn't have a disc reader or anything, so it's all digital. Though, I don't really mind, and if I did have games on discs or anything I wouldn't have gotten this specific series, because obviously it doesn't have a disc reader. I don't have a single complaint yet!! :)

If you don't need a disc drive this is a solid choice. The series X does have higher GPU and 4k capability, but for half the price this still feels like a next gen console. Frame rate is much smoother and load times are faster compared to my old Xbox One S. Graphics and details look sharper, especially when paired with a quality TV and wired connection. The capabilities it has are just right for what I need. Overall, it's a good alternative to the Series X in my opinion.

review_title: This is a great console for the price.
review_body: I was really blown away how great the Xbox Series S console really is for the price.  I wasn't sure if i was going to get this console because l had a Xbox One already but l finally decided to make the upgrade.I traded in my Xbox One console and bought a Xbox Series S from Amazon.  It was well packaged when it arrived and it wassn't hard to setup at all.  I was used to the color black on my Xbox One so it took me a while to get used to the color white on the Xbox Series S.The first thing l noticed is how quiet the Xbox Series S is.  It is not only very quiet but it is also faster than the Xbox One.  My games load a lot faster now and l am able to switch games on the fly.The games are a lot more beautiful to look at on the Xbox Series S than on the Xbox One.I almost got a Xbox Series X but after watching numerous Youtube videos l decided to go with the Xbox Series S mainly because of price.  I am very glad that l did and l have no regrets at all with my purchase.  I feel like l got a very good cosole for the price and what l get in return.
Everything else is fine, but there really isn‚Äôt space for big games.

Just to be clear, the xbox series s is an amazing console. In my opinion the best of this generation, maybe the best ever made even compared to the series x. I love it, and it works fine but 4 stars not 5 is because they did a really pathetic job packaging my shipment. I had to import this as the country I live in is out of stock, always, so it had a long way to travel. They threw it in a box with a ton of extra space and NO padding of any kind. When it got to me the box looked 20+ years old from being banged up so bad. It looked like what you'd expect original hardware retro console boxes to look like, like if you bought a sega genesis used. I like to keep my console boxes and display them and this was very disappointing. But more importantly, we are VERY lucky my series S was not damaged. It easily could have been. Please invest a few cents in some foam for your outer box when you ship expensive hardware like this.

review_title: High quality, low budget. No complaints!!
review_body: First time buying a console on Amazon was skeptical but it arrived intact, on time and I love it. To be real was still playing on my old xb1 from 2013-14 till it gave out a few weeks ago so instead of fixing it we decided 300 was a steal for this console and honestly so far it‚Äôs held up to all night long sessions of insurgency and enlisted looks awesome too on a $300 42 inch TCL ‚Äú4k‚Äù. Not true 4k gaming but as someone who‚Äôs career depends on my eyesight I assure you 1080p is no different then 4k unless you‚Äôre running on a monitor. Series s ($300) + 42‚Äù TCL Roku tv ($278) + the cooling towers that come with rechargeable controller batteries ($40-$60)make a solid $650 investment on a nice gaming set up. $650 is the same price as a series X these day just some food for thought. Also if you can choose get atleast the medium level spectrum plan. At a solid 80-150 mps DL rate I‚Äôve never even had a problem especially playing Xbox on my phone while my old lady watches Netflix on the same tv. Which is another feature I honestly dreamed about as a kid growing up In the 360 days! If you can and your a normal person looking to get a budget high quality gaming experience I‚Äôd jump on this!!
Looks and works perfectly.  Best affordable new gen game console ever :)
Came in perfect condition, I love it.

If you're coming from an old gen console like the PS4 or Xbox One, this is a wonderful upgrade.  The loading times are lightning fast while the console itself is small.  Once I get a monitor that supports 120 fps, this console will be even better.The only reason I gave four stars is because of the controller.  My controller's A button does not work properly.  I play claw so sometimes my finger presses the button a little bit diagonally, which is not supposed to be a problem.  But on this controller, if I don't press the button down perfectly centered, it will not work.This is a great console, just make sure your controller is not faulty.

review_title: Don‚Äôt underestimate this system and the value of gamepass
review_body: I ordered the series after trying all I could to get an X. I had mixed feelings when I placed my order. It arrived and that mixed feelings turned into ‚Äúyou should have done this sooner you d^mbass‚Äù. I don‚Äôt have an X, but I don‚Äôt think I am missing anything. To me the graphics is fine, performance is excellent. The only thing I may be missing is 120hz and guess what I don‚Äôt own a 120hz tv anywaysGamepass is where the goodies are at. As a father with wife, kids, work , social life‚Ä¶ game pass offers more than enough content to satisfy my limited play time. I managed to sign up for 3yrs at 1$ per month.The only upgrade I have is a cheap 2T seagate external drive. Moving series s optimized games takes just some few minutes. I cannot justify the cost of the super fast custom ssd at this time. Doesn‚Äôt make sense to me.If you are sitting on the fence like i was, go for it. You won‚Äôt regret!

This product is perfect

I've been always a PlayStation/PC user, and with a PC I always thought that having an Xbox is kinda useless since most of games are on both platforms. I promised myself that I would buy this Xbox Series S as soon as I see it on stock again, the reason? Xbox Gamepass, I know it's on PC too, but I consider Xbox Gamepass on an Xbox is something ever bigger, you'll feel like a kid on a candy shop, so many games to pick, probably limited by storage but it's all about how you manage it, the best part is that Gamepass can be used on PC and Xbox, the same subscription, that's something great if you're a PC user too, you'll be able to run games at a better frame rate on your PC but also enjoy Gamepass games that went only to console. I consider this console as a great deal, even if you're a PC user you won't regret, I really hope Xbox continues offering such a great service and adding more games to the service, if you take a look to what's coming on Xbox on the next years, especially for Gamepass, you'll realize that even if you're a PC user this is a great purchase and if you don't own a PC and don't mind playing at 1080p/1440p once you subscribe to Xbox Gamepass you won't regret your purchase.

review_title: Xbox series s is a great console for the price!
review_body: Im really amazed how fast and powerful this small console is and I bought this specially to play next gen games for now becuase of the ps5 shortage and how hard is to find one becuase of the expensive prices but for now I‚Äôm happy with this small beast console the only thing I hate about is the xbox controller is too big for my hand and heavy and also hard to reach the right joystick specially if you play fps games like Warzone and i feel like i got a faulty Xbox controller I don‚Äôt if it‚Äôs normal I feel the RT button vibration is making a noise like metallic sound I don‚Äôt know if that faulty or normal that‚Äôs the only downside the of Xbox but this is a great console just wish the controller was much easier to hold!The reason I gave 2 stars is because of the controller have vibration problems!

review_title: Perfect for what it's meant for
review_body: I'm a PC gamer, I own a jet powered pc at home, but since I can't lug a 50lb system internationally for work, I decided to give the series S a try to hold me over.I am enjoying this a lot more than I thought I would, the small size of the console is one of the most appealing aspects for me, aesthetically and it will barely take up room in my luggage.I have the series S hooked up to a 24" 1080p gaming monitor, and this console is more than enough for that resolution, and couldn't justify spending the money on a series x for it, even if I could find one in stock. Games like mass effect legendary edition and halo infinite look surprisingly good for an entry level machine.I'm very much enjoying playing all of my games on this until I get home to my pc. The Xbox series S is a great value and worth buying.

I got this Series S to replace my old bit still working XBox One. I love playing games on this XBox but it overheats quickly. I had to find a small wired shelf to put it on so it ventilated on all sides. When it starts making sounds I know it's getting hot. I even point a little fan at it sometimes to cool it down. I wish Microsoft would make a efficient ventilation stand for this, I would definitely buy that. But overall my games look great and run nicely. Good gaming console.
The product is in perfect condition, came before time has one console and a remote.. my son is really enjoying it.

I should have waited until more games I was interested in came out. I bought this console because finding a PS5 for sale sold for it's original price at best was a living nightmare. I wanted to get back to my roots and return back to playstation, but sadly this pandemic and people buying multiple consoles to sell them for over a thousand dollars made me consider the new gen Xbox. The Xbox Series X was always sold out leaving me with a surprisingly affordable Xbox Series S. After 2 full months of playing on this console the quality is actually very good. The time it takes for me to reach the login screen was less than 5 seconds and it takes less than 15 seconds to get back into my game. The main problem, unfortunately is not the console, but the games. I find myself uninterested in a lot of the newer games and the ones I was interested in have very poor reviews.In conclusion, a lot of the games I want can also be played on my Xbox one. Because of that I feel that I had acted to quickly in buying this console. My Xbox one have more memory space than this and I could continue playing games that have to be inserted in (disk). I eventually unplugged my Xbox Series S to continue using the Xbox One until something great comes out. I am keeping my fingers crossed that the upcoming games or games that either just came out like Elden Ring don't disappoint in reviews.

Love the small form factor of the XBOX Series S and the games look great upscaled on my 4K UHD TV set.  TBH, I picked mine up after using GamePass PC for several months and liked it and wanted to access it from a next gen console.  I wanted a Series X but couldn‚Äôt get one, so settled for an S.  I can‚Äôt pop in one of my old disks from my previous OG Xbox or 360, but most are available on GamePass or as digital purchase anyway.Pros- small and unobtrusive, games look great and even old games have visual and FOS improvements, very quiet, remote play is great, instant access through streaming surprisingly good, you can download games remotely using GamePass app. fast load times, quick resume.Cons - insufficient internal storage (you WILL need an expansion card or external storage after a while), gimped visuals and performance compared to Series X, user interface not intuitive - 360 and PS4 way better, no disk drive so no Blu-Ray movies or physical game disk.Other thoughts- I was using an external USB HDD for a while but new games won‚Äôt run from it (old games do).  I eventually decided to spring for the Seagate internal expansion card for $200, so consider this in your cost assessment.  Also exceeded my data limit with Xfinity in February for the first time ever downloading games, so don‚Äôt download everything at once.

review_title: If not using a 2k dollar TV this is will please you.

I play on the series X and there is no difference when on a subpar TV but when I play on my LG TV the series x is definitely a hundred times better! Also the only drawback is digital of course which is fine for her but alot of my games the disc versions are 80% cheaper than the digital version. Hopefully this won't be an issue soon with the new patent from Microsoft to authenticate discs to download digitally to the series S. Honestly if I did not have a 3000$ Qled TV I would have gotten an S as well. I also put this thing threw rigorous gaming sessions with no overheating issues at all!!!! Good job Microsoft üëè. I was always a Playstation guy but switched to Xbox after comparing the 2.
It's a direct bump up from the Xbox One S. with no disc drive.
Amazing picture quality - no over heating issues!

This is without a doubt the best and most exciting next generation console simply because it's deceptively capable and so easily within reach of nearly anyone who might be reading this. Yes, it's not top of the line, no, it doesn't have the most storage, but NO, neither of these things matter much if you're using a good 1080p screen. Lots of games perform within a stone's throw of PS5 frame rates and when you're in motion it can be hard to see the difference between it and its big brother.I have two of these, one for the living room, another for the kids play room and a Series X. The icing on the cake is how easy it is to modify either of them for emulation, it becomes a real powerhouse, and when you consider the price differential the value proposition here is insane.
Amazing all around highly recommended

review_title: Robust and budget piece of fun.
review_body: Before buying Xbox S I had a Playstation 4 slim, which I enjoyed much. Unfortunately it's gone after my flat was flooded by flat from above.So as alternative, after doing some research, I stopped on Xbox S series and start to wait restocking. Finally I've got my piece of fun. Xbox S for 299.99 is a good price. I am not 4k, 100 FPS type of guy, I just enjoy games and having fun. So for me Xbox S doing its job: A+ (excellent)As for design, it can fit to almost any room or furniture style, thanks to its classic, rectangle shape and white color: A+ (excellent). AND you can place it horizontally or vertically, which gives more opportunitiea to fit it.Software, internal management: A+ (excellent)Memory: B+ (above good), there is definitely room for improvement, 512 GB would be filled by 6-7 games. But from other side, it is fair for 299 price.Heat management is better then Xbox 360 haha: A (very good). Of course its fan located place is heated, but no rocket start ignition temperatures.Joystick: C (satisfactory)I was a dissapointed by it's joystick. Maaan, it feels, sounds and looks so chinese-cheap. Xbox button is sticking sometimes, I mean you press it, but it sticks and do not go back (you can see on pics).Rear battery cover is thin and bends a little when you pull it out. I am expecting this will be broken after 70-80 battery changes.So in total: 4 stars. I am enjoying my Xbox S series do not get me wrong. Really want to put 5 stars, but everytime I pick joystick, I wish Xbox S series costs 20 dollars more, but it's joystick has a pleasent grip, better look, better designed buttons.
Toma en cuenta el almacenamiento.Como soy de tener pocos juegos instalados no me afecta.
Way way faster than my one s.

Es un producto incre√≠ble r√°pido y funciona correctamente casi no hace ruido y la experiencia es incre√≠ble con todo el cat√°logo que est√° en Game Pass la verdad una excelente consola calidad precio!!
