review_title: Such a great console, with more games than I expected!
review_body: This made a fantastic gift for a gamer couple. We now both have one and play regularly.I didn't realize there were so many big name games for switch! When I first got on the console I expected it to be all Nineltendo games, but other developers like Bethesda have been adding content to the platform as well. Some great sales happen for non-Nintendo games too! We've gotten Minecraft, Outer Worlds, Skyrim (which works great with the joycons!), The Witcher III, Pokemon, BOTW, and Burnout, and they've all been great. The console works really well, just don't forget to get a large micro-sd memory card! You don't have to get the Nintendo brand ones, in fact I recommend SanDisk Extreme Pro, as they're larger size for the money and are extremely reliable. Same brand I use in my professional sony cameras that I use to produce films and documentaries!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: It has its pros & cons..but more pros!
review_body: I bought the Switch a few months ago and now that I‚Äôve spent some time with it (more than I‚Äôd like to admit ^_^) I wanted to leave a review.The Switch has many pros over other consoles, it‚Äôs main pro being that it‚Äôs a portable console with games that previously are only found on PC or console. I am a PC gamer and my PC is an absolute beast with an 8700K & 2080 Ti BUT the reason I bought a Switch is because oftentimes I am out and about and can‚Äôt bring my big honkin‚Äô PC with me. Obviously I prefer my PC but it‚Äôs nice to be able to play games like Witcher 3 and then  when I have to go somewhere in the car or something I can seamlessly ‚ÄúSwitch‚Äù to the Switch and continue my game.There are some absolutely AMAZING games on the Switch: Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, Witcher 3, Splatoon, Super Smash Ultimate, etc., which are worth buying the Switch. This is especially true for people with kids as most of Nintendo‚Äôs big hits are kid friendly. You may not want your very young children to play violent games like Call of Duty or Battlefield 5 but they can definitely play a similar kind of game with Splatoon 2 only instead of shooting bullets to kill people they‚Äôre splattering paint all over each other.However the Switch also has its cons. Let‚Äôs start with Nintendo‚Äôs ‚ÄúE-Shop‚Äù. The E-shop sells games that are WAY overpriced. They charge $59.99 USD for games that have been out for years. The fact is you can buy physical copies of these games for less on Amazon AND you have the benefit of being able to resell the game later if you want too. Not so with digital games.Then there is the price. Yes the Switch is $299 which is cheaper than Microsoft and Sony‚Äôs consoles but when you factor in the cost of necessities that are almost required for optimal play (Pro Controller, SD card, Screen Protector) the cost adds up quickly.All in all though I do recommend the Nintendo Switch. It‚Äôs a great console for anyone who just wants to have a good time and it‚Äôs especially great for families or people with young kids who want to play games with them without worrying about violence, drug use, sexual situations, etc., that are in a lot of other games.5/5 Stars

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I've always loved Nintendo and every console that they've made but this one, really makes it to the top of my list! It's portable, light-weight and, pretty thin. Also, Amazon has a ton of cute cases to choose from so that you can bring your console for when you're on-the-go. The buttons feel comfortable to the slightest touch, everything feels smooth. Even the joysticks and trigger buttons have no resistance so there's no need to press them too hard. product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Great for younger kids or mobile gaming.
review_body: This is, strangely enough, the first portable system I have ever bought in my 30+ years of gaming. I‚Äôve actually bought 2 Switches so far. The first one was a Christmas present for my son who I was trying to ease into video games. He loves it. After him having it for a year and me occasionally playing it to help him through areas where my greater experience with games could help get through certain areas, I was tempted to get one for myself to play when I had long periods of downtime at work. When Witcher 3 came out for the switch, I bought another one for me and have been playing it a few times per week since.My experience with the console is pretty much strictly in the handheld mode. I bought a Satisfye grip and case for my switch which allows me to hold the system more comfortably than I would without it. Holding the standard system and playing for more that 20 minutes or so causes my hands to cramp. The small joycons are just too small for adult male hands to use for long without some discomfort. I‚Äôm fine with that since the small size makes the system easier for kids, like my son, to use. A regular controller can be a bit bulky for a grade school age kid to use well. With the case and grip, this system is perfect for me to throw into my vehicle at work and forget about it until things slow down when I‚Äôm waiting for a call. Then I can break it out and pass the time in style.All in all, I have no complaints about the system, my son loves it and uses it constantly. I like it for its portable nature and surprising computing power. It is the first portable system I‚Äôve experienced that didn‚Äôt feel like a downgrade or gimmick. The Switch instead feels like a true portable version of a larger console like PS4 or XB1. I still play on my PS4 far more than I do the Switch, but I can‚Äôt take that system to work and play in the office or car. If you have young kids, or a desire to game on the go with something better than your phone, then it‚Äôs hard to go wrong with the switch.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: A satisfying multi-use gaming device for the family
review_body: The Nintendo Switch is a nearly perfect gaming device for family use. With our one-TV household our Xbox Series S spends more time streaming Netflix than gaming while the Nintendo Switch can entertain both on the big screen and away from it.Out of the box it took a bit of time to get gaming as you need a Nintendo account. Pokemon Quest was the simplest and quickest to get going with. We haven't yet tried any "physical" games meaning we've only tried games you download (which the Xbox Series S/X excels at.)The multi-modality of the Nintendo Switch is great but be prepared to be disciplined with the various bits or you'll lose them. You'll also want to buy a screen protector and a carrying case. The build quality is pretty good but there is some flex when using it in mobile mode. The default brightness is underwhelming while the max brightness of the screen is only good enough if you are used to top-end mobile phones. The controller buttons are not backlit and have small print so for older parents like me you'll have to memorise what is X, A, B, Y etc.Nintendo Online is somewhat confusing and not quite what you get from Xbox Game Pass. Setting up kids profiles from the parent's Nintendo account is more complicated than it should be and creates blockers if you are away from WiFi. Nintendo, just let people play offline or online and sync it later.The games on offer are family friendly without being childish. You can relive Super Nintendo games with the Nintendo Online subscription. There are more games to create and explore than games to destroy and kill. The free-to-play games include some usual suspects but the list is quite short. There is no Roblox on the Nintendo Switch, yet, and you'll have to buy Minecraft, again.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Worth it if you want it
review_body: The ability to swap from dock to handheld still amazes me to this day. The library of games is crazy good, The battery life isn't bad, and the build is fairly durable. The screen is prone to scratching due to it being plastic, but a $10 screen protector fixes that easily. The controllers do go bad over time. I would recommend also purchasing a pro controller due to it having a better feel for me personally and they last far longer than any Joycon I've had. This purchase date was for my sister but I've had mine since near release and have gone through 3 pairs of Joycon, meanwhile my oldest pro controller (between 4 or 5 years) of the 3 I currently have has only shown slight signs of degradation. There is a "Nintendo tax" on some games which basically means they cost more than they would on other consoles (e.g. Borderlands collection I got on pc for like $20 where as the switch is charging $50 for games released between 2009-2014 so that you can play them on graphically worse hardware, but the portable part may be worth it for some people with certain games). The online services are really bad a lot of the time especially when playing with people who are far away or have otherwise unstable connections. Playing with random people online can be a very painstaking process a lot of the time. With all this being said, I love this console. It is the only console I use (I also have a pc and a ps4). I only look at it so critically due to how much I love it. If I didn't spend hours and hours using this thing I wouldn't be telling you all it's flaws in a 4-star review. It can be frustrating sometimes, but the exclusives are amazing (there are also a lot of great 3rd party games but I mainly mean that BOTW is a masterpiece and Mario Odyssey is phenomenal) and the "home console and handheld" idea is honestly incredible. I basically wrote an essay about this thing to tell you how much I love it.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: Okay, so, initially I thought the Switch was a bit overhyped mainly because of the price. However, now that it has dropped I find it to be a fantastic investment- especially for casual gamers. It's so nice to just curl up on my couch and enjoy my favorite games.The experience of mashing buttons really reminds me of the DS and Game Boy days, but the fact it has a touch screen as well makes some things more convenient depending on the game. The Switch can give you multiple experiences considering it's joycons can come off and attach to a controller like the more modern gaming systems. You can play from your Switch's screen, or hook it up to your TV.I find the quality of the screen to be really good as well. Obviously it's not juiced up like a PC setup, but considering the amount of power and versatility that is contained in one small device it is IMPRESSIVE.The main downside to the Switch is the pricing of some of it's games, as I see no reason the mobile version of most games should be priced like PC games. However, many of these pricey games also have a lot of effort put into them so it is understandable. If you're like me and casually game normally buying games when they're on sale, this isn't much of an issue.My overall experience is amazing and I plan on getting many games for my Switch.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Bit of a rocky start but good for now!  Wish it was as sturdy as my old PS2,  now that is a beast...
review_body: I bought this system for myself as a birthday present, and I have enjoyed using it!  The controllers took a bit getting used to detaching on and off properly.  I think the main thing is to be careful about what games you buy if the device will be worth it to you in the end, or if you are excited about upcoming games.  I waited to purchase the Switch until I knew there were about ten games I wanted to play and added about three of them into the in initial cost as well.  I‚Äôm pretty picky about my games because I am a casual gamer. Zelda breath of the wild‚Äîwhich I borrowed from my brother later‚Äî is more intensive than anything I have played in YEARS.Games are expensive in physical format, although that is my preference.  There are some cheaper games on the online store.  So far my favorite local game shop does not have any used copies of Switch games although they have everything else.  Maybe some day.I might buy a screen protector for it in the future but have not as of yet.  If your Switch is to see heavy use by an entire family or if as an owner you plan to travel with it I‚Äôd recommend one but that is not the case for me. I did have a problem within a month of ordering the machine where the fan started whirring LOUDLY.  At first only when it was plugged in to charge then all the time when it was at rest, then at last even while playing a game.  I called Nintendo customer service and had it repaired (although I had to send it back three times with the same issue to a radioshack in Syracuse NY.  Last time I sent it in they just replaced the system.)If I have a problem in the future I will request replacement rather than repair, especially if it‚Äôs going back to New York.  Just not happening.  At least customer service was good, but I was becoming a bit disgruntled toward the end there with their techs!  For my troubles customer service gave me a new set of controllers automatically and then later, three months free on the eshop.  Oh, and the second and third shipments were two day free.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Buy it for the exclusives or don't buy it at all.
review_body: If you look at Nintendo's list of exclusive games and think, "Yeah, I'm all about that", dive in. This is a fun console that offers play on your TV screen or handheld (switch... duh). With multiple controller configuration options including extra peripherals that will make your controller become a steering wheel, a golf club, a fishing pole, and a fitness ring just to name a few, there is a lot of fun and creativity built into Nintendo's latest console.Add to all of this, with a Nintendo Online subscription you get access to tons of free and low cost games. They have included a virtual NES and SNES console with a good selection of classic games. There are also other free games like Tetris 99 and the new Super Mario 35 which are loads of fun. There are also lots of other games that can be had for as little as $2.99If however you're looking for a console to play the latest cross platform hits, you're probably better off with a PC or one of the next gen gaming consoles. Playing a big cross platform game, you will notice a difference in graphics quality. The Switch only displays in HD, while every other console (and pc) is up to 4K now. Plus the Nintendo controllers, while fun and creative, will not hold up to long term play for something like a FPS. They are fun controllers, and work perfectly for the Nintendo games, but they feel like they would ultimately break after a few serious button mashing sessions. If you've seen all the drama about controller drift, you now know why.Bottom line is if you're all about Nintendo exclusives like Mario, Zelda, Animal Crossing, Metroid? (please?), get this console. It will provide a great deal of entertainment. If you're trying to play the big gaming hits available across all consoles and PC, there are better options.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I got this Gray version of the Nintendo Switch after a few months of hunting for retail price $299. There's a couple of websites out there that will notify you of in-stock. I happened to be able to grab it off of Amazon, but GameStop, Target, Walmart, Best Buy, etc, also have them as well. With it being in stock is rare, so you just have to look and be patient! Plan a few months ahead for birthday / xmas gifts so you have time to wait for a retail priced stock is in. Enough about the INSANE price gouging....I am very pleased with the Switch and am very happy with it. I have played on it for a week so far and everything is working fine and dandy, as it should. One gripe is that the storage capacity is small so only a few games can be played at a time, but with a micro SD card, possibilities are endless. I ordered one of those, and expect it soon so I can expand my downloaded game collection. I've enjoyed the Switch so much I'm getting some additional joycons and a grip and a charging station. I'm going to continue looking for accessories. Maybe a case I also had to get a TV adapter because my old TV only has one HDMI port, so I had to RCA to HDMI it up in order to not unplug and replug my Roku every time I want a bigger screen. How that goes is yet to be determined.I'm still figuring out how the dock station works (TV debacle), but for the most part - no complaints! I haven't played it with more than one person yet, but I'm positive that runs smoothly as well!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Situation Better than You May Think
review_body: First of all, I wanna say that although Amazon may have some date when they say it will be in stock or some date when they say it‚Äôll be delivered, just know that it may be earlier than anticipated. I ordered mine thinking it wasn‚Äôt gonna be here until  around June 4th, so about 3 weeks to a month after I ordered the switch, but fortunately, it came 2 weeks earlier! Apparently, I‚Äôm far from the only one who has experienced this, and a number of people have gotten their switch earlier than expected, so don‚Äôt look at the date thinking that‚Äôs when you‚Äôre gonna get it, ‚Äòcause you may just get a nice surprise like a number of customers did. Yes, there are some stock issues with the switch at the moment as well as some production issues, but they are not as bad as they‚Äôre made out to be, so if you are thinking about getting the switch, go ahead and pull the trigger! Also, DO NOT BUY FRON SCALPERS. As some other people have mentioned, they will buy a switch and then sell it for a greater price than needed in order to make a profit, and although it may be tempting to buy from them so you can get it sooner, it is so not worth paying the extra money when the situation is actually better than amazon makes it out to be. Don‚Äôt do yourself a disservice and fall into the instant gratification trap. Be willing to wait a little bit longer for your switch. YOU‚ÄôLL BE GLAD YOU DID.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Great overall system for gaming with friends!
review_body: Similar to other Nintendo systems, innovation is always attached to their new ideas. The joy cons are similar to the wii remotes, albeit not as precise for some games where they were used for shooting type games, the joy cons are incredible for multiplayer. I honestly prefer using one joycon whenever I can when playing games, it's really nifty being able to play two player automatically with a friend or family member without having to pay for an expensive controller, or a cheaper built one.Nintendo Apps are so-so at the moment, it would be great to have streaming apps such as Netflix for streaming, but other apps such as Youtube have worked well streaming but I do not like the interface for searching for videos.When playing online, after paying for a year subscription, was not as bad as the days of the Nintendo Wii, but it could be better. Wifi play has always been a struggle for companies and consumers that I don't expect to go away with any patch made by Nintendo. Buying the year subscription also includes many nes/snes games you can play with the joy cons in single/multiplayer. My roommate got rehooked playing super mario world and it was a blast seeing someone who says they "hate games with bad graphics".Overall, if you're looking for a system for on the go or for a house hold device, the Nintendo Switch is a excellent system with a good range of games to play on. My young nephew and kid siblings are a fan of it; and same for me and several of my friends who are in our early 20s.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Elegant compromise between handheld and console
review_body: In terms of raw horsepower (CPU, graphics, whatever) the Nintendo Switch is far behind the current generation of consoles like the XBox One.  But, the Switch is a unique device.  As a handheld, it is quite powerful (the latest iteration nearly doubles the handheld's battery life, addressing the Switch's greatest weakness).  This allows you to play the same game on your TV and keep playing it as you take it out with you --- a unique ability.Most importantly, there is a staggering array of software available for it.  Software is what makes or breaks a console, no matter how good it is.For example the Zelda game "Breath of the Wild" is a visual stunner with a huge open world.  And this is the first portable system that has the full version of Skyrim available for it (the reason I bought it --- a high quality port of Skyrim with the 3 add-on packs).  Nintendo has also done high quality ports of other gems from older consoles such as "Mario Kart 8" as well as a lot of new titles such as "Super Smash Brothers Ultimate" or "Luigi's Mansion 3".In addition,their digital store has a lot of quality indie games such as Stardew Valley.Also, if you purchase the Nintendo Switch Online membership ($20/year) Nintendo also gives you a large selection of NES and SNES classic games.  The membership is worthwhile for that alone.Basically, because Nintendo is ONLY selling the Switch as a current console (the 3DS is on its way out), all of their best software goes to the one console.  And that gives developers strong incentives to bring their best titles over as well.If you want a wide variety of games, the Switch is a good choice.  If you want THE best console graphics or performance, obviously the Switch isn't for you.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: This switch saved my marriage.. for now.
review_body: This is my second purchase of a Nintendo Switch Animal Crossing edition. I was bummed out when my wife took my switch hostage claiming it for herself to play Animal Crossing, especially since Monster Hunter Rise had just come out. I was even more bummed out because I had missed out on buying the MHR switch edition because my rationale mind decided I didn‚Äôt need a second switch. I was left with 2 options, leave my wife & fight for custody of the switch or purchase another during the shortage brought by on by the epidemic. Surprisingly after a few months of contemplating my decision the switch prices went back down to an affordable price. It still wasn‚Äôt easy finding a switch in stores so I took to the internet where I was surprised to see a brand new switch going for regular price. I quickly added the item to my cart & purchased right away! It was delivered with upmost care like a stork bringing me a new baby. Everything was brand new, I was taken back to a simpler time in my life, opening presents on Christmas day. Finally after a quick software update I could play MHR months after its release! Little to my surprise my wife quit playing Animal Crossing shortly after I got my new switch because she went down Korean Drama rabbit hole on Netflix..

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Such a cute switch! I love it!
review_body: I couldn't believe my luck when I was able to snag one at MSRP after the release date. It's so cute! I like the design of this one much better than the other switches, and the dock is adorable, especially if you're an Animal Crossing fan. And it's the newer version with improved battery life, too! I was thinking about getting a switch for a while, but the lack of games I absolutely had to have and the colors (I'm not a big fan of the standard colors/designs) put me off. Animal Crossing solved both of these problems with ACNH and this amazing special edition.My only complaint (other than how difficult it was to get - finally caught a restock in the middle of the night and even that sold out in less than 5 minutes) is that sometimes one of the joycons gets stuck when trying to remove it from the strap. It's probably just an issue with mine in particular, but it does make it kind of annoying to remove. I have to put some force into it, and I'm sure that one of these days, I'll accidentally scratch myself trying to remove it. Otherwise, it's very cute, and at MSRP, I'd definitely choose it over the other colors!PS - I hear that this version is restocking, at least in Japan, so absolutely do not buy from scalpers! When I was hunting for this, there were at least 100 being sold by scalpers for ~$500;  now there are just over 20 for $750 each. It's cute, but it's not worth making a scalper $400+ off of other people's desperation. Just wait for a restock, or buy a regular switch and put a skin over it.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: The Switch is riddled with controller disconnects and pairing issues
review_body: After owning the original Wii for years and enjoying it with 0 problems I decided on getting the Switch, even though I mainly play my games on PC now a days, I thought it would be a great console for my wife and I to come together every now and then to play. I was lucky to score one when Nintendo finally got it back in stock after months of no stock because of the pandemic. The first day I got it the right (red) joy con kept disconnecting every 5-10 minutes. I was literally 5 feet away from the console with line of sight. After going through the troubleshooting steps of disconnecting joy cons and updating the console OS and controller firmware, it still had the same problem. The left (blue) joy con worked flawlessly. I searched online and found hundreds if not thousands of posts about people experiencing disconnecting joy cons and various work-arounds. Some even claimed that by having your foot propped up in front of the line of sight would cause all sorts of controller issues including lag and disconnects. So I did my long hours of testing, purchasing new official joy cons, and 3rd parties and am discouraged by my findings.Ultimately I found that the built-in bluetooth radio in the switch is just not powerful enough. Considering the amount of posts regarding controller pairing and disconnects issues, I would say the problem has been known for a long time. And instead of Nintendo recalling or replacing their poorly designed consoles they blame the environment or user error. They state things like "make sure your console is away from wireless devices of any kind". Seriously? Everyone has 20 wireless devices in their house from cell phones, routers, modems, smart TV's, wireless speakers, smart hubs, Alexa devices, the list goes on. Nintendo even states to keep the Switch away from fish tanks. Really? Soon they'll be saying to keep the switch away from air and light.I contacted Nintendo within the first week I got the Switch after getting fed up with dying because of constant controller lag and disconnects. Tier 1 support is a joke. They just want you to send it in which customer pays for shipping, and I may get my console back in 30 days. So after back and forth discussion with Tier 1 support I finally found that there is an escalation line which they forwarded me to which seems to be a line of seniors or assistant managers. Again they wanted me to send in the console. I called BS and explained that the console was only a week old. We finally agreed that I would temporarily pay for a replacement right joy con, and only after they received my defective right joy con that I would get reimbursed. New right joy con came, had the same problems albeit it was less noticeable, less disconnects. I sent my old one to them and it took them 30 days to refund my money which was $50 because they had to inspect the controller for any damage or mods. Seriously? I eventually got my money back but what a pain.Fast forward about a month and lag and disconnects are still happening. I purchased a brand new official joy con from Amazon and even though it hasn't outright disconnected it has shown lag issues again, sitting 5 feet away from the console and with direct line of sight. I even started unplugging wireless devices like my wireless speaker, just to see if anything would increase the controllers range and reliability and nothing helped.At the end of the day the Nintendo Switch is riddled with controller issues and I am not even getting into the whole "drifting" problem that people are suing Nintendo over. Now a days it seems that companies just release untested unreliable electronics, even the all and might Nintendo company, and don't take responsibility for it. A player needs reliable controllers to play a consoles content AKA joy con controllers for the Nintendo Switch, like a player needs a reliable mouse and keyboard for playing PC games. And for the price tag of an official Nintendo Switch joy con set at around $70 I expect them to be flawless, and their from from it. And this console isn't even new. It's been out for several years and Nintendo has had plenty of time to fix their issues, and they have chosen to blame us, the consumers instead of taking ownership of the problem.I plan to exchange the Switch for another using the Amazon exchange policy. Luckily, my purchase qualified for the holiday return policy so I have until February 1st to return it. If the new one acts up the same way I will be returning it and will be calling my credit card company to reimburse the 4 games I purchased from the Switch store since the Nintendo store has a no refund policy, which is a complete joke and such a policy should be discouraged.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: Alright so since the Covid-19 outbreak has officially ruined my sisters senior year she had started getting into animal crossing. After playing on the I Phone app for what felt like forever she decided she wanted to transition to a game on the 3ds console. Since she had started playing animal crossing new leaf she fell in love with the series. So as her big sister I had decided I would get her this limited edition themed switch in hopes of helping with her depression as well as to cheer her up for her senior year being ruined. Also so she could get a taste of Animal Crossing new horizons for when it comes out March 20th, 2020!  The day I told her I purchased it she hopped with joy. I was excited too considering I was sharing my own excitement for animal crossing with my sister. It had finally arrived. Its box didn't come in damaged and the console was packed safely to prevent possible damages. It works perfectly as any nintendo switch should with no defects at all in the console itself. The only concerns I have to remind future buyers is that the joycons will stop working properly after a year of use. This is coming from my own nintendo switch experiences and other fellow switch owners where the controls will drift randomly while you're trying to play a game after a year after consistant use. So I'd be best to invest in a second set of controllers just in case.All I have left to say is that this was indeed worth my money and my sister couldn't be happier with her early senior graduation gift!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: My daughter loves it

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I've been wanting a switch for a long time, and finally managed to get my hands on one close to MSRP (at $307) during the pandemic. I only have one game on it so far, but to say I'm pleased and impressed so far is a bit of an understatement. It's nice to be able to play on my TV in the living room, and when someone else wants to play their own game or watch Netflix, I can just take the switch out of the dock and play in handheld mode, but stay in the same room and socialize. I like being able to bring the game into my room and not be forced to play it in the living room if I don't want to deal with all the noise.It's pleasant to hold, with just a bit of weight to it to feel sturdy. The Joycons are nice to the touch, although the sticks are a little too 'smooth' for my liking so I put some grips on. I haven't experienced any drift, yet, but it's only been a few days. They're very satisfying to hold, and even more satisfying to click into place on either the tablet or the included joy-con grip. I haven't tried the straps yet.The screen is lovely, and the speakers are front-facing so it seems louder than other handhelds. It IS a little frustrating to adjust the volume while I have it on the kickstand. The kickstand is a pain to pull out, and isn't sturdy in the slightest.Overall I'm very, very happy with it. I can't wait to get more games on it and play with friends.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I managed to snatch a retail price Switch away from scalpers somehow.  Which took about two months of attempts to pull off!  Anyways here is my honest assessment after watching repair videos.The Switch is an excellent console at an excellent value (As long as you can obtain one at MSRP).  However being what it is the Switch itself is fairly fragile.  If your child has the self control of Angry German Kid(tm) this would not be the best gift for them.  And if playing it in undocked mode understand by all that is holy that the Nintendo Switch is not a modern smartphone.  There is no water resistance built into the design.  Submerging the switch or even spilling something onto it will likely be the end of the console.  The docking port is another point of fragility.  It won't suffer being slammed into the dock well.  All of the weight of the unit is baring down on that port while docking so being gentle and sorta gingerly easing it down is advised.  The Joycons are also rather fragile.  Not flimsy but they won't tolerate mauling like let's say a PS1 controller could take.That being said I do not think the Switch is cheaply made at all despite these points.  The owner and operator just has to accept that they need to be gentle and they'll be fine.  And I don't mean you need to treat it like a china cup.  But this is NOT the kind of console for a roid rage neanderthal hopped up on Monster drinks and adrenaline.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Tons of games to choose from
review_body: Great system.  My son owns one but has it with him at college so I decided to get one for myself and I must say it's got such a huge selection of games.  I still have my 3ds but didn't realize how much Nintendo had expanded on game selection and variety. I'm a huge animal crossing fan so I bought this version of Switch since I played the first one on the 3ds.  Their online eshop, accessible through an online connection, has an almost endless selection of games.  You can buy physical copies or digital copies of games and some are digital only through the eshop.  As a longtime gamer (I own a PS4 and original owner of a regular NES I bought in 1989), I can honestly say this is Nintendo's best system since you can play it on your TV but also take it with you (portable) like a 3ds.  You can also play games on it offline so you don't have to always be connected to the internet.  This is a console that is great for all ages of people, young or old and when I'm tired of hack and slash on my PS4, the Switch has many chill titles of games to relax with.  I'm 52 and enjoy mySwitch a lot.

review_title: It's everything I could've ever dreamed of and more.
review_body: I had experience with the Switch since my family had a shared one for a while, but sometimes you get tired of passing the console around so I got one of my own! I'm so glad I was able to get the New Horizons one because it's so much cuter in person and as an avid Animal Crossing fan since the 2001 Gamecube release here in the west, it's just so good. It took a while since this design is so popular but when I finally caught it during a restock period I knew I had to grab it!I love the color scheme, and seeing Tom Nook with Timmy and Tommy on a lil' island is so precious <3 The all around aesthetic makes it feel like both a console and an artpiece dedicated to your new journey on a deserted island.If you're a big AC fan who can afford to get it and you're able to grab one when they're in stock, I'd say to go for it. Nintendo most certainly knew what they were doing when they made this design because I had wanted this Switch since day one.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: Call me crazy.....I bought the original switch a while ago and never played Animal Crossing before. When everyone was talking about New Horizon during the start of the Pandemic, I thought to give it a shot. Boy, I should not have done it :) I started spending all my free time paying off my loans to Tom Nook, hunting for villagers and trying to decorate my Island. Like many, I got kinda bored after everything was unlocked and got tired of the Villagers repeating the same over and over again. I thought of resetting my Island, but didn't want to lose everything I had worked for so hard. Then Nintendo announce to release the ACNH special edition switch again and beside I didn't like the idea of buying another switch, it was a great opportunity to start another Island with an ACNH themed switch. Anyway, I didn't regret spending another $299 - the switch is VERY cute and fits perfectly on my shelf. Beside still having my old switch with a developed, but basically abandoned  Island I mostly play on the new ACNH switch now. I know it's very hard to reset your Island, but if you don't have the money to buy another system, you may want to consider it. Starting from scratch actually  does bring a lot of the lost magic back.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Good for Gaming on the Go, but not the ideal console for all gamers
review_body: It's a good console. It's not amazing. There is a limited selection of AAA games, more so if you like action and FPS genres. You have more than enough RPGs to choose from and a lot of the Asian anime style games (not sure what they're called). Nintendo's own selection is PG as always. It sounds odd to say this, but my mistake was buying this when I'm not a Nintendo fan. The lack of support from major developers and studios means that I eventually turned to a laptop to meet my real gaming needs.PROS:Gaming on the move: great on airiplanes and to bring on tripsEasy couch coop for supported gamesHolds charge for a good amount of timeMain console body is durable AF. I dropped mine down a flight of stairs and it had no dentsCONS:Joycons are a straight rip-off. They will fail on you then you'll have to pay 40-60 USD for replacementsLimited game selection (this is the biggest issue). Almost none of the large developers are supporting the Switch. Some of them are trying, but the Switch hardware is already behind the times with current-gen releases and you get knocked-down graphics. EA gives you remasters or roster updates, Take Two remasters decade old releases, etc. and all of these are released at crazy prices. You pay US$ 40 for games being sold for $5 on PCs and consoles, it's ridiculous.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: My nine-year-old son saved and worked in order to buy a Nintendo Switch. He bought it with his own money and I couldn't be prouder of him. We bought the Animal Crossing edition only because it would have been available earlier than the standard version. He said he didn't care how it looked as long as it could play Switch games. Originally, Amazon delivered a completely unrelated package and said it was the Switch, but their customer service sent the replacement as soon as the issue was reported. Kudos to Amazon for that. My son has only used it in handheld mode since there isn't a TV available for his use. He has never placed it in the dock so I don't know how that would work. We've had it for a couple of weeks at this point. Here is my son's review:I like it. It's been good so far. Its most impressive feature is the battery life. One charge can last for six hours of continuous gameplay. It also charges more quickly than any other device I've ever had. It goes from around 4% to 25% in 10 to 15 minutes. I'm happy I bought it.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Pokemon came out, so I had to get it.
review_body: I knew people who owned the Switch were seemingly all very happy with it, and I planned on getting one at some point. When Pokemon moved to the Switch, "some point" became "right now".Nintendo likes to make their consoles unique. The DS Lite had two screens, a touch screen, and a microphone that were all used to make the experience unique. The 3DS, The Wii, and Wii U also had their own interesting elements. At times, it just felt gimmicky. The Switch on the other hand, doesn't feel that way at all.It's the gaming equivalent of a laptop with a docking station. You can have the TV experience like any other console, which is also great for party games. Then you can take it with you. This is basically THE go to gaming device for plane rides. The joycons are also genius. It is just incredibly versatile.I'm pleased that it has USB C. The Dock is easy to connect to as it literally just drops in place. I do think it could use more apps. it pretty much only has Hulu and YouTube at the time of this review, if I'm remembering correctly. I am a bit of a geek so I have plenty of other devices to watch on, but if it wants to compete with some of the other devices, it would be nice to have the option of watching Netflix, for example.I remember when the Wii first came out, and you'd go play the sports games with whoever had one. The novelty wore off before long. The Switch however, is here to stay. Brilliant device

review_body: I got to admit, I was a little ticked off at Nintendo that the day this switch arrived at my doorstep, they announced the OLED Switch.That being said I am VERY happy with this purchase!  This console is beautiful and is a very nice upgrade to my launch day Switch that died last month.  Throw on a couple of pretty cases to help protect this and you have an amazing set up on your hands.  Nintendo has always made high quality consoles and special editions like this Animal Crossing Switch help showcase that very well.  Now even though the OLED was announced as well, it looks like the same specs just with a better screen.  Very nice for those who prefer handheld mode.  I use mine in the dock most of the time so I didn't really need that.TLDR: If you want a really nice Special Edition Switch then don't be dismayed by the OLED announcement.... the Animal Crossing console is very nice and well worth the money. üëå

review_body: We bought this for my 7-year-old son's birthday & he couldn't be happier!! This is by far the most adorable Nintendo switch console out there!! I definitely recommend purchasing it.We bought it when it was $300 plus tax. I do not recommend paying any more than that price.. just wait till it gets back in stock & buy it for $300. Do not purchase it from greedy scalpers.. keep an eye out because as soon as it gets in stock it sells out usually the same day! We are so fortunate we were able to get one in time for my son's birthday ..we purchased this back in October & held on to it till December for his birthday. If you want one for Christmas, I doubt you will be able to get one at the $300 price ..unfortunately it's sold out till mid January.. but if you can I say go ahead & get it! This thing is adorable & really is a great collector item for any Nintendo fan! Even if they aren't into animal crossing. It is a very unisex design. I believe it can be for a boy or a girl. üëç

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Nintendo Switch w/Grey joy cons V2 HAC-001(-01)
review_body: This review is for the Nintendo Switch w/Grey joycons, V2 HAC-001(-01). I've owned the original Switch(HAC 001) and recently, the Switch Lite(Turquoise). Battery life wasn't so good with the original Switch and only a bit better with the Lite. This Switch model has improved battery life, up to 40% depending on brightness settings, volume settings, and the type of game you're playing. Another thing I've noticed is if you download digital games, it takes less time. The graphics(colors) seem to be more vibrant.If you're a gamer who likes to play games on the T.V exclusively, this would be the perfect choice. On the other hand,someone who enjoys gaming on the go, might find it cumbersome carrying this console around. It won't fit in your pocket. Just something to keep in mind.Lastly; if you buy plenty of digital games, a micro sd card of 32-128gb is a must. Another basic necessity would be a glass screen protector, as the plastic screen does scratch easily. There are two models, one with the grey joy cons and one with the red and blue joy cons. The Switch with the red and blue joy cons seems to be the rarer model and is sought after by gamers for it's resell value. There are plenty of games available for the Switch, something for everyoneand more to come. If you have your old Switch, it isn't really necessary to upgrade to this newer model. However; just for the improved battery life, I would recommend it.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: If you love being around people, get the Switch!
review_body: I absolutely loved the concept of the Nintendo Switch and decided to get one due to its popular demand. It‚Äôs pretty awesome and best to get it at the normal price of $299.99 because it really isn‚Äôt worth $300.00+ and it really refreshes the gaming atmosphere. However, handheld mode is so enormous that it‚Äôs a little uncomfortable. I was on the fence about buying this or the Nintendo Switch Lite, because I rarely have anyone else around to play some really cool multiplayer games like Mario Kart 8 Deluxe or Super Smash Bros. Plus, the Switch Lite doesn‚Äôt come with controller/joy con problems and is smaller, more comfortable, and accessible. One other thing that stands out on the Lite is it has a smaller screen but games look a bit sharper on it. That said, some of the free games are pretty addictive! I think it was totally worth the $300.00, but it does cost $20 to buy Nintendo Online to play any Nintendo game‚Äôs online player. I also wouldn‚Äôt recommend buying a Pro controller because the joy con controller is pretty comfortable, so far. If you‚Äôre someone who loves hanging around friends and family, get the regular Switch. If you‚Äôre a solo and lone wolf type of badass, get the Switch Lite!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Decent console with a nice option for the tv/projector
review_body: Hey, it's a Nintendo for 2021. It's fast, simple, and the games are clean. No long loading times and the controls are fairly intuitive. Battery life on the joy-cons is great, though the handheld version is a little lackluster... that's fixed by treating it like a standard console though... so yay.Only real sticking point is the price. For 300 bucks, it feels a bit steep. Many of the games feel like time-eaters for casual players, and there's no browsing or media to speak of. Again though, this is Nintendo and as a game console, it plays games. They play smoothly and have a very finished feel to them. Sign of the times and all that.Overall, a very nice machine if you just want to sit down and play without all the bells and whistles.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I want to start by getting the obvious out of the way. Scalpers = Trash, and I cannot believe with everything going on right now that Amazon is allowing them to sell at such inflated prices.  Wait for the official Amazon restocks because they charge MSRP, now onto the Switch.Love it. I cannot say that enough.  The console won't blow you away, but it will keep you entertained for hours. Whether you play in docked mode or handheld mode, they both work very well and looks very good on both screens.  The battery on this generation is much improved over the day 1 release.  The battery itself is the same size, but Nintendo put in a more efficient processor which extends the battery life.The game selection is wide and varied, if you like shooters, you can find them here. If you like platformers, look nowhere else, you have some of the greatest ever made. Not just this generation, but former generations in the Nintendo Eshop.The rundown is the Switch is a great console and worth the $299, just wait until Amazon gets it back in stock, stay far away from this worthless scalpers.Last note: Follow @FatKidAlerts on Twitter, he is always keeping up with Switch stock on Amazon, and that is how I finally got mine for MSRP.

The joy cons come on and off easily but stay in place when you want them to. I do recommend getting a protective screen cover because over time the dock the game system goes into starts to kinda make places on the screen over time. Over all a great investment and good buy

review_body: First things first I got my Switch from Mums Collectibles & Stuff so this will mostly be a review of them as I've already owned a Switch and knew what to expect from the system.What most people don't realize is that consoles are in high demand this year (2020) and we all know the reason so I can't fault a company for increasing the price on item due to high demand and low stock of said item. That being said Mums Collectibles & Stuff is by far the cheapest I have seen a new switch go for on amazon, ebay or a number of other websites.On top of all of this one I bought the item from them they had it ready and shipped the next day as I did buy it rather late at night. With an estimated arrival time of 2 weeks I actually received it a week early which I give my thanks to UPS. When I opened the package I found they took the time to make sure that the switch was secure and safe with two layers of massive bubble wrap which was just extra enjoyment.All in all they are the cheapest, quickest and most reliable source to get a switch right now.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: Needless to say, the Nintendo Switch is so much fun and a great way to kill time.  But on top of that, this particular console's Animal Crossing theme is just the cutest I've ever seen.  I never liked the primary-looking colors of the OG console, so the soft blue and mint green joy con colors really appealed to me.  The back of the switch itself has rivers and islands etched onto it as well!  It's the little details that really make a difference for me.  The dock is a light cream color with the raccoon travel agents on the bottom right.  I'm so glad this set was available again because, although I'm sure I'd be happy with the OG console, I'm so much happier with my Animal Crossing edition.  It makes me smile every time I see it.  I've never even played the game before I bought it, but it ended up being my first game purchase and it makes me even more happy that I bought this edition.  I love it!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: This system is so beautiful and I got it for not too much more than the actual retail price! On top of it all I received it within days of ordering, picked it up early from the post office and I‚Äôve played it at least once a day since owning it. The fact that it‚Äôs the updated version of the Switch with a better battery life means I can play longer on the go, and I don‚Äôt think a review of this version of the console would be complete without mentioning the gorgeous Animal Crossing New Horizons designs on the box and dock. The dock is completely white as opposed to the standard black, and features adorable artwork of Tom Nook, Timmy, and Tommy on a deserted island. The joy cons being a pastel green and blue instead of the neon I‚Äôve grown accustomed to with my parent‚Äôs Switch is a great contrast. All in all this is a system I‚Äôd highly recommend if you love Animal Crossing and definitely something for a collector to pick up along the way! 100% my favorite special edition version of a console!

review_body: It's really nice to take your console game anywhere you want! It sucks that Nintendo didn't give us enough storage space, so make sure you buy a microSD card to store your games and their content. I read that it's better to buy the physical game discs. They take up less space, but if you want to download all of your games go for it. If you play a medium amount of games I would recommend the 256GB - 512GB microSD cards. There is a 1TB microSD card on amazon for around $300.00. Get this one if you're a hardcore Nintendo player. There are many accessories on amazon to also decorate your Switch. You can decorate the controllers with skins or buy the different color joy-cons. The exclusive Pickachu one has nice Pichachu designs on the stand, and I think there's also an Eevee version both from Japan that cost $500 or more. You can also buy the Switch Lite which seems much more available now with the pandemic raging. Explore and find the version of Switch that works for you.

review_title: Brand New Animal Crossing Edition Switch for MSRP
review_body: For anyone looking to get an Animal Crossing Edition Switch without paying more than retail price, my advice is to be patient and check back here frequently. At random times, a few consoles will be restocked and available for MSRP (thank you to the other customers in the Q&A who tipped me off about this!). Just a couple minutes after coming across that advice, I refreshed the page to test it out and this is exactly what happened. Originally it said it would take over a month to arrive but I ended up receiving it less than a week later. Just make sure the listing says "Ships from and sold by Amazon.com" to ensure it's not a third party seller and that the price is exactly $299.99.In terms of the product itself, I had already been playing on another Switch for a while and it's a great console (aside from the infamous joycon drift issue). My preferred play style is docked on the TV but it works perfectly on handheld mode as well. The Animal Crossing edition is super cute with its pastel joycons and ACNH-themed dock, I highly recommend it!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: One of the Coolest Gaming Devices I‚Äôve Owned
review_body: The only time I‚Äôve used a Switch has been playing on one that my friends own. Just these experiences has really intrigued me into getting my very own Switch. I love playing video games and I own an Xbox and PS4, so I figure at some point it was time to complete the trifecta. While I‚Äôm more of an Xbox person, I will say I am very impressed by the Switch. It is a very simple console, but genius in of itself. I‚Äôve had some Nintendo gaming devices here and there. A SNES back in the day, but mostly their portable ones from the Gameboy to the Advanced to the DS and 3DS. The Switch combines that of a home console and a portable gaming device and for that I love it. I can put it in the dock and play it on my TV. I can play it handheld which will be great for road trips or maybe just wanting to play anywhere. This was a brilliant move by Nintendo and it makes the Switch really stand on its own.Now what I‚Äôd say my favorite thing about the console is it‚Äôs simplicity. This device is made for one thing only and that is for playing video games. The console is both modern and old school at the same time. Would definitely recommend to anyone who really likes Nintendo and their games.

I put it on the dock to charge and nothing. I thought it was dead forever so I ordered a new one from Amazon. Later I went to see if my old Nintendo would power up after I charged it. What I was not doing is pushing in the power button enough, after I pushed the Nintendo powered up. So now I own 2 Nintendo‚Äôs. It‚Äôs great to have 2. This new NS works great just like the old one. I could care the less about the game Animal Crossing but I like how the NS looks. Also there was waiting time if I wanted the exact one I have. Over all the NS is great! In fact I like it better then Sony play Station or X-box I don‚Äôt even play them anymore. I love it I can play the old games from Nintendo and others. The first game I played was PONG back in the day. Nintendo Rocks!!!

review_body: My family has been an XBox family for some time, but with a toddler we were looking for something a little more family friendly so we purchased the Nintendo Switch. The idea is mind blowing, but the functionality is inferior to other gaming systems I've owned. I haven't even had it for a year and the joysticks don't work like they should. They work on the controller but it doesn't translate in gameplay. If I try to turn and look around my television screen (or the screen on the Switch) just stays in the same position. Or if I try to move my character a specific way, it goes a completely different way on the screen. Very disappointing.

review_body: This is my third switch so that I can have three Animal Crossing islands because I‚Äôm insane, also I have severe ocd - same thing I guess?, and I am absolutely in love with the AC theme. I have a different style/color for each one so I can tell the islands apart but this one is def my fave. The Switch is my console. I have played a couple of games on ps4 (Atelier games that weren‚Äôt out on Switch until more recently), but now that those games are on Switch I will get them as soon as they go on sale. I love the handheld option because I can play while my husband watches something on our tv, and I love that it can also be docked so I can see things on the big screen. I play mostly handheld. It plays smoothly with the joycons and a pro controller. You can even play with a pro controller when it‚Äôs not docked if you don‚Äôt want to/can‚Äôt use the joycons. I‚Äôm sorry about the novella. It‚Äôs just enjoyable and I recommend it.

review_body: Spent several days during the COVID-19 pandemic searching high and low for a Switch anywhere.  Most of what was available were 3rd party sellers charging $100 to even $200 over market value which is asinine.  Missed a couple stocks at Best Buys that sold out in seconds.Finally I just put on Netflix and had Amazon open and kept refreshing.  Missed a couple then finally had some used listings straight from Amazon for get this, $280!Order was delivered in two days.  Came in original box and had everything in packaging basically like it was new.  Screen had a protrctive film which was cool.  All controllers and adapters were nicely placed in plastic sleeves.  Everything was pretty much flawless.  The only thing is one joy con had barely any battery and the other was dead.  Not a huge deal got it charged in dock quickly.Everything was factory reset and when I started it up it was like it had never been turned on.DON'T BE SCARED TO BUY USED! AND DON'T LET THOSE PRICE GOUGERS TAKE YOUR MONEY!PATIENCE IS A VIRTUE! I was diligent for not even 48 hours and just kept checking and refreshing and eventually it paid off!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Product is great! Resellers... not so much!
review_body: TLDR: Product is SO CUTE!! BUT doesn‚Äôt do anything special compared to a regular Switch (other than give 10/10 on aesthetic) so don‚Äôt buy unless you can afford it/the look it worth it to you.Long review:This product is amazing!! The pastel colors are so cute and the texture on the back adds a great extra touch. The dock has an AC graphic on it which was a great addition tomy living room! The packaging is also well thought out leading to a great unboxing experience. Of course this works exactly like every other Nintendo switch, so this is entirely about aesthetic.With all of that said, the price gouging on this product is insane. Because it is a limited edition the reselling price is crazy, and because it does nothing a normal Switch can‚Äôt do, so purchasing this is a novelty. If you have the cash to drop go for it (I was lucky enough to get one at the normal price). But as I was hunting one down when they were first announced, I watched people buy them up and list them at inflated prices before it even came out. So maybe consider if you want to give those people your money.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: One Year Later as a Switch owner
review_body: I‚Äôve had my Switch for about a year now and I can say it‚Äôs a very fun console. It‚Äôs no where near as powerful as the PS4 or Xbox but the fact that I can take my games on a road trip or play it at home is pretty awesome and convenient for gamers. The Joy-Cons do get loose however over time and will slide off without having to press the release button so I would recommend getting a grip or a case like the picture shown above. Another thing I wan to mention is the joy con drift, which can get really annoying at times. Having to calibrate them in the settings menu every other minute can be really annoying and for others, ruin the experience. I usually use a pro controller while playing on docked mode and I don‚Äôt run into any issues but the problem persists when I‚Äôm playing on table top or handheld. Besides the minor inconvenience here and there, I think the Nintendo Switch is great, especially with third party games like Skyrim or the Witcher 3 being ported over to the Switch. It‚Äôs a great little console.

review_title: Be patient it‚Äôs worth the wait.
review_body: I was so lucky!!! I happened to randomly check one morning after I had already given up on my search for a switch at retail price and THEY WERE IN STOCK FOR 299!! (sold by amazon) I nearly cried of happiness and immediately bought it. It took a week and a couple days to get here, there was a delay in my delivery. I was worried they had sold me a sold out switch but nope it came in! Just hold on and be patient and don‚Äôt buy from these greedy scalpers. A few things about the system itself:The stand is hard to pop out if you don‚Äôt have nails (especially if you bite your nails like me) so I bought a stand for it. The game cartridge part is a little hard to take out at first too and I thought I broke It but it‚Äôs flimsy plastic so it bends.The controllers are kinda small if you have larger hands.I would also recommend a screen protector, carrying case, and a stand (so you don‚Äôt have to keep opening the kickstand it comes with)

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Some points - From months after purchasing
review_body: Awesome Console I get to run many games I've never gotten to play before, here's a few things:The screen and around it get items or "spots" Items and spots as it the tiny crack between the screen and the rest of the console, same goes with the speakers but you could use a toothpick or something small.The spots that I talk about look like if water or any other liquid had dried on the screen even though I never drink n play and they usually can be removed with ease(by rubbing) however I've had to use the backing of one of my rainbow pins to break it down so it could be scraped off with my fingernail. Thankfully it didn't scratch up the screen.  Quality, certain games that are usually meant for quality look absolute garbage on switch(dbd, subnautica/below zero, etc). this usually can be fixed if you set it up on TV and up the quality or toggle with the settings however if you're on the go and wanna enjoy the game it'll be rather difficult. The Battery is still golden after a long time use! Pricing; when this console was bought it was 240-300 now its way more? This is a scam Nintendo!If anyone is looking for something like this just invest your money elsewhere like maybe the switch lite or one of the DS's. It's not worth it.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I expected a bit more when it came to the Switch and I was a bit let down. First of all, I feel like the design is counter-intuitive especially the docking system. I don't understand why you need to place the entire tablet in-between such a cramped space where you could accidentally scratch up the device. There are so many bells and whistles that snap on and off it becomes rather annoying just to play a simple game. You can scratch up the joycons just by sliding them into the joycon grips. Why did you design it that way? The kickstand on the back of the Switch is a joke. It's so hard to open and isn't long enough to support the device. Also since, the power cord plug is directly under the device, you can't plug it in when you're using the kickstand. So many design irregularities and inconveniences. Fifty million buttons all over the place, which means fifty million ways to play one game and hold the controllers. It's so chaotic and annoying. Fun features such a streetpass and an internet browser are not on this device. This device still isn't powerful enough to compete with Playstation or Xbox. Just playing this device in your hand is a struggle because it is so freaking huge and weighty. I wouldn't buy this for a child, they can stick with the 3ds. To be honest, I had more fun playing on my 3ds and vita than the Switch.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: switch online is worth it in and of itself
review_body: Playing switch games is great, i bought 5 games with my system for variety. Turns out the most amazing feature i was not aware of before i started playing. The online subscription they offer for a measly 20 bucks a year offers a library of nes and snes games you can play at will. You can save state in them as well up to 4 save files for each game. You can ALSO reverse time when playing (it is a cheap feature but VERY cool still) Died in mario, just hold in two buttons, reverse the game like a dvr on tv show and bam, try that part again right where you just were!! i do not know if it is true but i read they have two more slots for future classic systems in their coding in the system. We have Nintendo 8bit, Super Nintendo but we could see Nintendo 64 or game cube in the future as well.All 5 games i picked up for it run great as well, no complaints except it was 150 dollars more than list price. Alas these are the times we live in.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Worth the money wait and hunt.
review_body: Ok. The Switch is a masterpiece when it comes to the library. I‚Äôve spent more time than I would like to admit playing Breath of the Wild. Smash Ultimate is the best in the series, along with Mario maker 2.The resolution is a problem for some other hardcore gamers, but HD is fine for me. I really don‚Äôt care if it‚Äôs not ‚Äú4K, 60fps‚Äù.The controls are super advanced. Li always play with the grip, even if Motion controls are recommended. I don‚Äôt personally own a Pro controller for the switch, but I‚Äôll consider it. I have a Wii U Pro-controller which is my favorite controller for the system.The Switch approves upon the Wii U in most ways. The Wii U does however possess a better UI, more comfortable controls, and Virtual console.Overall the Nintendo Switch is worth the hunt and the money. The console has the best library since the N64.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Great console but problem with controller
review_body: The console worked great.  I didn't have any problems playing the games.  However, the controller had an issue.  It would only work for an hour or so and then would say, "problem connecting."  Of course this meant I wasn't able to use the controllers.  I actually purchased two pro-controllers that worked great with the game.  Amazon connected me to Nintendo service team and they tried to help me reset the controller but that didn't work. They said that I needed to send back the game so that they could try to repair it and if that didn't work they would need to send me another game.  I just returned this and got the Nintendo switch blue/red console instead. That one works perfectly without any issues so far.  So although I love the Nintendo Switch I am not a fan of the animal crossing version which is why I am rating a 3. The nintendo switch red/blue version will get my 5 star review.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: This was my first hand held gaming device and I think it is a very unique, innovating what a portable console should be. I love the portability of it on the go and the ability to allow multiple players play at once. For $300 I think this is a solid gaming console that can be used to pour hundreds of hours into and still find games refreshing. The Nintendo game lineup also has the best exclusives out of the other competitors, from Mario to Zelda to Animal Crossing, there‚Äôs a game that suits anyone‚Äôs taste. Of course there are improvements to be made such as the joycons being small and sometimes uncomfortable in the even if you put it in together like a controller, it still doesn‚Äôt replace the feeling of a real full sized controller. In the future, I would just like Nintendo to make the portable screen 1080p with a 120hz refresh rate for an even better gaming experience. But overall, with its creativity and innovation still standing strong 3 years later, there isn‚Äôt much you can‚Äôt love about the Nintendo Switch.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Careful buying new from a refurbishing company
review_body: I was quite disappointed with finding a very noticeable crack in the screen (1st picture). The description made it seem like the switch only had minor flaws (if any) like those displayed in the second picture I shared. It took a bit of maneuvering to get a shot with the minor scratches in it. These aren‚Äôt so noticeable and I don‚Äôt mind them but the crack is an eye sore and I can only hope my son isn‚Äôt upset when he opens it for his birthday next weekend...Initially, the seller didn‚Äôt provide the accessories (plug and such) and I didn‚Äôt notice this error til after they emailed me. They were very quick to realize their mistake and corrected it right away. I actually got the email the same day the accessories arrived so it was absolutely fine in my book. I just wish I hadn‚Äôt paid full retail price for an item with such a major flaw in it. It seems to power up and work just fine though.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: A ‚Äúcan‚Äôt miss‚Äù for the casual gaming household
review_body: Our household doesn‚Äôt buy the latest, greatest gaming systems but it was time to upgrade our original Wii for another family friendly system. The reviews were pretty glowing for the Switch and I can say they‚Äôre warranted. Just make sure you buy the newer generation (this product) so you have better battery life and less decline over the life of the product.I love how Nintendo the Parental Controls essentially live within an app on the parent‚Äôs phone. A motivated kid can hack just about anything so keeping these settings non-local is a brilliant little safeguard. My kids have to ask me for ‚Äúmore time‚Äù when they‚Äôve hit a daily limit (which is customizable for the day of the week). It‚Äôs very much like a simpler, more reliable version of Apple‚Äôs Screen Time feature on iPhones. Of course, you can also unlock more time on the switch itself using a pin code.It‚Äôs also worth mentioning that Nintendo did a great job with the ‚Äúuser assisted driving‚Äù feature on Mario Kart that helps young kids and inexperienced gamers be competitive. It really is nice to bring my youngest daughter into the joy of Mario Karting.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Incredibly fun! Can also use parental control to track playtime and protect console from siblings
review_body: I bought this just to play Animal Crossing: New Horizons, and it didn't disappoint in the least! It's incredibly fun!One cool feature is that if you set up Parental Control using the free app, it will tell you how long you've played each day. Since I'm neither a parent nor do I need to be controlled, I disable restrictions and play-time limit so it doesn't actually interfere when I'm playing, but it is a bit sobering to see that yesterday I played for 6 hrs and 40 min.Also, if you set the play-time limit to 0 min everyday, the console will prompt you to disable Parental Control via a PIN. This could come in very handy if you have a sibling or roommate who likes to steal your Switch.I would also recommend getting a screen cover, either plastic or glass. I have a glass one that adheres like a second screen and haven't had any trouble yet, but then again I've only had it for 8 days and treat it very carefully.Overall, a great product, and worth every penny!

review_title: Excellent Device sold from an Excellent Seller
review_body: I thoroughly enjoy the size, versatility, and portability of this product! Easily one of the best handheld devices ever manufactured. Nintendo has completely out classed their competition with this wonderful piece of machinery that is guaranteed to have you busy for hours. And this is coming from a die-hard Sony fan :). The sleek but comfortable design of the joycons makes intense gameplay surprisingly seamless. Their massive game selection ranges from AAA titles, to RPGs, First Person Shooters, and MUCH MORE. There is so much more that could be said, however, it‚Äôs too much to type! Lol. If you‚Äôre looking for an excellent game console that you can play either casually or continuously, look no further. Additionally, if you‚Äôre like me (frugal) and you‚Äôre on the fence about shelling out the money, don‚Äôt be; it‚Äôs worth every penny. Also, this seller moved my shipping up to one day shipping FOR FREE!!! Literally the BEST SELLER I have ever had the pleasure of interacting with. Would definitely order from this seller again. Do yourself a favor and buy the switch!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I was suppose to receive my package October 27th. I didn't receive my package until the 29th. It wasn't Amazon fought at all. I blame USPS for screwing up. They sent my package to the wrong address. So I had to go online and have them redeliver my package.When I finally receive my package I notice it wasn't damaged or tampered with. The switch box was still intact thank God. One thing I notice is the switch itself looks more premium if that makes any type of sense. Lol You can tell they fixed a lot issues with the joycons and other things. My OG switch had so many flaws. My TV screen would go black then turn back on for some reason while playing. The vents on my switch ended up melting off. The back had so many scratches from the dock.Anywho, the battery life is amazing!! If you're like me and you play your switch an hour a day. It will last for a couple days. If you're the type that play your switch for hrs. You can get up to 9hrs of play depending on the game you're playing.Im glad I got the upgraded version. 5/5

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: For the child inside all of us
review_body: I love my Switch, this console really brings me back to my childhood, there is something about it that recaptured that magic I felt playing my Super Nintendo and even the GameCube. I've played every Nintendo console and while I was a major fan of the early ones, after the Cube, I got sucked into the Xbox 360 and then the PS4, but, this console is the first I've played in years that brings me back to that childhood magic. I got this console on a whim after watching Detective Pikachu and realizing how much I missed Pok√©mon games, so I had to get Let's Go Pikachu and pre-order Pok√©mon Shield, as well as getting back into Mario, and checking out Fire Emblem Warriors which is totally amazing. All in all, not only are the exclusive games amazing, but, the console and even the joycon controller rig are something special. I can't put my finger on it, and I really can't put it into words, but this is a great system and for kids or those trying to rediscover the child inside of them, this is a must have. Just don't try to get inside a child with this is, or you're going to jail sicko.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I know this isn't an Amazon product but I can't start this review without mentioning the awesome job this company does in keeping its customers... <-- which for some reason some other organizations have forgotten, anyways.  I first purchased the Nintendo Switch about 2.5 years ago.  recently, there was a problem with the Switch and it stopped turning on.  I called Amazon, at which time they let me know that I surpasses my warranty on the item.  I immediately was disappointed and than immediately relieved for the next thing the Amazon representative told me was that I was going to be able to receive a $340 refund of the 399 i spent on the item.  After 30 months, if you tell me that I would receive almost a full refund after my warranty had run out... I am still in shock.Now as for the Switch itself... We love it.  It's not a Playstation 4 or Xbo 10000 or something.  But it's a great family system that also is great for when friends and relatives visit.  Recommend the Switch for every household.
