product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: It's Nintendo's newest generation console - you know what this is.
review_body: I'm mainly going to list off the pros for this unit, something I like that they did on this generation compared to the other consoles by Nintendo and some gripes.Portability obviously with its docking capabilities - very good move.  The way the Switch locates itself within the dock is a cool party trick.  I like not having to have a rucksack full of gear just to bring my system with.The Joy-Con controllers are passable and you can actually play 2P games with each one.  I do wish they offered a Pro-controller bundled version.The setup of the system is easy, you don't have to fill out another mortgage worth of EULAs to play.For pennies you get a slew of NES and SNES games through Nintendo Online.Mario Maker 2 is pretty fun and I wished more games had BYO levels like it(cue the wave of gamers that will correct me on 20+ games that have their own world-building options. I'm 43 and don't have time for games like I did in my teens.  Let me dip my filthy casual toe back in the game pool now that my kids are grown.)

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Beautiful Switch - Definitely worth the buy if you can find one
review_body: Definitely love how bright the colors are on this switch, more of a neon pastel shade. The switch is the V2, which has extended battery life and a more efficient CPU. Comparing this switch the the V1, the IPS panel has a warmer tint whereas the V1 is much brighter. Though color values do vary across switches. The joycons themselves are more of a matte finish on the coating rather than the glossy feel on previous joycons. The colors match well with the dock and will definitely stand out by your TV. The dock itself is a bit wider compared to the V1 allowing more wiggle room to prevent the switch from being scratched, though I do recommend purchasing a glass screen protector. The pattern on the back of the switch definitely gives it an "animal crossing" feel to showcasing. They did a really good job in making the pattern stand out compared to previous special edition switches.Overall, pretty happy with having a new switch that stands out and has a longer battery life. Will definitely be a well-used switch in the coming months.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: No regrets. I waited and snapped it up when it was in stock again at retail price.
review_body: Finally got my hands on one at the retail price last month (To hell with price gougers.  I don't ever support them. I hope they die of Covid) and I am having a lot of fun with it. I'm usually a pc gamer but I really like that this is portable too. The battery life is nice and the motion controls are alright but I tend not to use them.  I was confused about where to put my micro sd card till I looked it up. It's hidden under the kickstand which is kind of flimsy and the only real con when compared to the list of pros. So far I've got Skyrim, Lego Harry Potter, My Time at Portia, Nine Parchments, and the Deponia games to occupy me for now. I've wanted one of these for a long time and I do not regret my purchase.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Won't work on Hisense ROKU tv
review_body: I purchased this in July but didn't get to set it up until yesterday.  Set it up on my Hisense ROKU tv and it worked for about an hour.  Had a ball with my niece playing dance 2020.  I won a round and figured I'd quit on a high note.  She played with it not using the tv for about an hour and then it was bed time.  Woke up today to try to use it and all I'm getting is a flash of the game console and then a "is it connected message?".  Did a quick youtube search and came up with plugging/unplugging, get a new cable, get a new docking station and changing the settings on the Hisense.  Didn't want to do that because.....wth???? I came here to see if I could return it and saw that I had past the return window.  Then tried it on my older smaller bedroom tv and it worked fine.  Seriously disappointed that it won't work on the newer, bigger main living room tv.  Today is a holiday so I'll contact nintendo support tomorrow to see if there is a fix for this.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: For quite some time Nintendo has been underwhelming when it comes to hardware specs on consoles. To the point that I switched to buying only the handhelds after the Gamecube. With the jump to an Nvidia GPU, not only does the bar for graphics get bumped up significantly from what Nintendo has released recently, it also allows third-party title developers the ability to bring their fun games to Nintendo for releases.Let's state that this isn't as powerful as the PS4 or Xbox One, but still has very good graphics. Not only that, but being able to undock it and play it like a handheld is an awesome feature. Switch Online, a service needed for online gaming, also includes NES and SNES titles you can play for free (included in the price really). My ONE issue, is that chat is needed through an external app. If this is done so the playing experience online requires less bandwidth in the rooms and therefore is smoother on the servers, than it makes sense. Otherwise, seems a bit annoying to have to need another device for it.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: Pretty colors and works well.  Had an issue at first where the left joystick was charging slower than the right, but I re-synced the joysticks when the switch was in the dock and after that no problems.  Had another issue where one time the image wouldn't show on the TV, and all I had to do was unplug everything, plug AC adapter into wall and also directly into switch (not dock), and then unplug and replug everything into TV.  Every piece of tech has its occasional frustrating moments like this but it's been pretty easy to fix anything that comes up by googling solutions.  The graphics are wonderful when playing on an HD TV.  Note that the Animal Crossing: New Horizons game is NOT included.  Go buy that too!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Great Console for a Busy Life
review_body: When I was little I used to be able to spend all day playing games. Of course as I got older, my amount of free time decreased exponentially. If, like me, you need to balance your job and college life but still want to play games, this console is a really great choice. It's loaded with tons of pick-up-and-play games that are great for quick 30 minute sessions. The handheld mode makes it really accessible and portable, and the new model has a great battery life. My only big complaint is that the controllers when in handheld mode don't always feel securely attached to the sides of the console. There is a small amount of wiggle if you move the console that is not really enough to bog down the experience, but is still noticeable enough to feel sort of cheap. Overall though this is a great console for a busy young adult still trying to find time for their favorite hobby and I highly reccomend it if you're interested.

review_body: Glad I was able to get this edition of the Nintendo Switch. I wanted to purchase the Animal Crossing Switch earlier in 2020 when it first came out, but it was quickly out of stock. My order arrived in a timely manner and in great condition. I only have 32 GB of memory, but I haven't come across any memory issues yet while playing a few games. I like that this console not only has a cute design and fun colors, but it came in a neat Animal Crossing cardboard box with every item needed for operation neatly organized. I had to buy or download my games separately from this purchase. This does not include the Animal Crossing: New Horizons game as part of the package.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I was able to place an order for this beautiful console the day of release during a brief period when they were available for the actual retail price of $299.99 and not for some inflated cost.  The console arrived today and in great condition. The driver handed it to me directly, which was wonderful. The colors of JoyCons are two of my favorites and are quite peaceful to look at. The dock is adorable. A refreshing alternative to the standard black. As soon as I took the Switch out of the box I applied a tempered glass screen protector on it.  I was also able to transfer user data and save data over from my old Switch to this new one. Something I wasn‚Äôt aware I could do, which was a very nice surprise. I really hope they get more of these beautiful consoles in stock soon for the rest of the Animal Crossing fans.

review_title: Nintendo hit a home run with the Switch.
review_body: The Switch is the console to have. We were very lucky to get one during the worst of the pandemic when they were sold out everywhere. Amazon really came through! Our 8-year old has loved playing Animal Crossing while stuck at home - 12 weeks so far! It's going to be a quiet stay-at-home summer, so I'm glad we have this as a distraction.We also have a Wii U which in many ways is the first generation of the Switch. A lot of ideas that Nintendo tried out on the Wii U went on to be implemented even better on the Switch - such as the handheld game pad. And the games! Mario Kart 8? First on Wii U. Breath of the Wild - Zelda? Also on Wii U. We love our Wii U and love the Switch even more!

review_body: If you‚Äôre willing to wait, Amazon occasionally gets some, and puts them up at regular price.  Received mine much sooner than their initial estimate. Less powerful than its competitors, but ray tracing does not a good game make.Just do everyone a favor and don‚Äôt pay a scalper for the console. That‚Äôs the only way to choke them out. Stay patient and check multiple stores, regularly. Eventually you‚Äôll find one at the proper price. product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Five Shooting Stars Across the Board
review_body: Notice how people who have verified purchases have only given 5-star reviews (as of this writing on 18 March 2020). This is for a reason.I love this system. It is the most beautiful combination of the Switch backing, Joy-Cons, and dock that Nintendo has ever released for the Switch. The overall design, especially Nook and the Nooklings on the dock, is so cute and the pastel colors for the Joy-Cons, like all other Joy-Con colors, look so much better in person. I'm so happy to be a huge fan of Animal Crossing and receive such a beautiful Switch.Nintendo needs to manufacture a lot more of this Animal Crossing edition Switch and they need to make more themed Switches in the future. If you don't have a Switch and you can get this one at a *reasonable* price, don't hesitate to purchase it.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Always innovating, Nintendo has the best console this generation.
review_body: A Nintendo Switch with extended battery life? What's not to love? It's a no-brainer! Nintendo is always at the forefront of console innovation and they didn't miss a beat with the Switch. Want to play a game on your tv like a traditional console? Drop the Switch into the dock and game on in 1080p HD. Need to hit the road? Slide the Switch out of the dock and continue your gaming on the go in brilliant 720p HD. And I haven't even gotten into the built-in option for multiplayer gaming with the removable controllers. Like I said, cutting edge console innovation from Nintendo! Come for the innovative console, stay for the myriad of both cutting edge and nostalgia-inducing first party titles from Nintendo. Not into Mario and Link games? How about the largest library of quality Indie games and old-school games? No matter how you look at it, the Switch is where it's at!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I absolutely adore the Switch and Nintendo as a whole, I‚Äôve had a dry spell with them recently and buying a Switch changed that.Anyways, as many of you already know, the damper on production ability and rise in demand have seriously affected the availability of this product. BUT you can still get them new, at MSRP, like I did!There are bots that can notify you when there is stock for any specific model, color you‚Äôre looking for. I used a Discord called ‚Äústock informer‚Äù and was able to get a Switch at its actual MSRP within a day.Be careful out there, don‚Äôt cave in to the gougers. It‚Äôs not worth it. You‚Äôll be spending a lot on games, anyway. So save your money!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: We got lucky and only paid $299.99 for this Switch. If I were you, I would hold out until you can find one for MSRP. Don't pay these ridiculous inflated prices.It came new in the box, never used, and came with everything needed. Power adapter, dock, HDMI cable, joy-con grips, and the wrist straps. Switch had half a charge upon arrival, and set up just fine.Joy-cons work great.Reads and plays a cartridge game. I'm excited to play this more! It has very nice feeling controls, incredible graphics (compared to the Wii that I was used to), and the console is very small and compact.Don't hesitate to pick this up. But before you do, DON'T pay $400 or over for it. That's ridiculous.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: A worthwhile purchase with hours of fun for the whole family
review_body: I took a break from gaming consoles before I got this. My last home system was a PS3 and my last handheld was a Nintendo DS. I couldn‚Äôt find any games I was really into or anything that seemed worth my time. I got the Switch after having seen my friends using it and after a few minutes of playing Breath of the Wild. Let me tell you.... this system is wonderful!! You‚Äôre really getting two systems in one!! Being able to play on the go as well as just plug and play is such a wonderful concept. Not to mention the game options and variety. I‚Äôve played over 70 hours of Breath of the Wild, and loved it. The other indie games available are also great additions. Overall, it‚Äôs a great system. Worth every dollar. I haven‚Äôt had this much fun with a gaming system in a while. Great job, Nintendo!!!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: I bought it for Animal Crossing
review_body: On the whole, this exceeded expectations.  It not only connected to my TV, the cable was included.  I can use it as a handheld game machine or put the controllers in the "Joy-Con Grip" to use as a wireless PC game controller.  Everything I hoped for, right out of the box.  One "feature" has me tearing my hair out,however.  The positions of the A and B buttons are reversed.  The do it and cancel action buttons.  It's like a non-qwerty keyboard for a touch typist.

review_title: So glad I found this Switch on Amazon!
review_body: I had been looking for the Switch for my son sunce earlier this year. Due to Covid it was either constantly sold out or the prices were jacked up. I knew the MSRP and refused to be ripped off. I constantly looked at BestBuy, GameStop, Walmart, Target and others with no success. Both Amazon and EBay were too high priced. I told my son it was doubtful he would get one in time for Christmas and he had accepted that. Then a miracle happened and I found this Amazon seller who sold it for MSRP, plus shipped it quickly so we got it in time for Christmas! Highly recommend! Thank you. It works great too!

review_title: V1 Switch, NOT the V2 FYI
review_body: This is the originally manufactured V1 switch, not the V2, which Nintendo rolled out later with some incremental upgrades. So you are buying and older switch, which was probably made before 2019 and has been sitting on a shelf ever since. Works fine otherwise but I figured you guys should know.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I‚Äôm late to the switch party, but so glad I came. Haha. It‚Äôs 100% worth it. I got the gray, so it‚Äôd be more subtle. Figuring out how it works is very easy & it‚Äôs quick to catch on. I have downloaded all the classic mario games, YouTube & Hulu. It‚Äôs SUCH a throwback to see all the classics again & hear those familiar sounds. The Nintendo membership is only $20 a year, which gives you access to all those free classics, so in my opinion, it‚Äôs absolutely worth it. I use it everyday, whether to watch movies, or play games. I love it so much & would highly recommend.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Seller was great and console works perfectly
review_body: I love my Nintendo switch. Even though it was overpriced, I understand that it is due to low supply due to the pandemic so I am not that upset about it as the console has been working perfectly and came with everything advertised. The only problems I ran into were low memory and short battery life on the device but those were easily fixed. The seller was also very helpful and the switch arrived much earlier than expected and on my birthday, coincidentally. Definitely worth its original price ($299) and even though the rise in price is disappointing and definitely pricey, I would argue that its also somewhat worth it. Playing on this is a good way to spend lockdown, so I don't regret making this purchase.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Fun, simple gaming experience. No censorship.
review_body: I haven't enjoyed a Nintendo console this much since N64.  The mobile feature is pretty cool.  No Netflix and extra stuff.  Eshop is simple.  System processes games quickly.  Worst part is the peripheral devices and other things are expensive.  Games don't deflate much in value, and then people buy up the physical copies.  The eShop will help you get those hard to find games.  Nintendo doesn't censor games either. Very important.!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Great product. But buy a case and a micro SD
review_body: Great product. Ordered it in the morning, 5 hours later was at my door. We live in beautiful times.Definitely recommend getting a Switch with colored joycons like this one, the black ones are dull and these Red/Blue ones retail for up to $80. Comes with everything you need except a carry case (which I would recommend instead of putting in your backpack lose) as well as picking up a good sized Micro SD card. I got like a 200gb one for $30-40 so I will never lose one of the tiny came cartridges.It's light weight and feels a little fragile, but not cheap feeling. Just wouldn't recommend dropping it like EVER. Anyway, great for all ages like 8-99yo. Bright screen, kick stand is a pain to open at first, but I've used that part like 2 times in 3 months.All n' all, would recommend!

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I was happy to see that I received the V2 of the system. I‚Äôve seen some reviews of people getting the old version and I was a bit scared.The system works very well (so far). The only problem I see is that the left joy-con (blue one) its a bit wobbly, compared to the red one, when they are attached to the system itself. The red one doesn‚Äôt move at all but the blue one does. I hope it doesn‚Äôt fall apart on me.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: Just like the title shows this console has lot of mistakes.First mistake is the charging when you go to charge it that it'll automatically turn on which will ware it down more sooner if not shut down after being plugged in.Second mistake is not able to be put it into airplane mode while operating in TV mode until you put it into handheld mode which makes no sense because it shuts down both the wireless controllers and Amiibo instead of having options to shut off the online function without disconnected everything else at the same time when feeling playing offline in TV mode.Third mistake is the charging dock and this one got me confused because in the front part where screen goes is solid plastic which will scratch the screen which I was aware of from watching YouTube videos and I was smart enough to get a screen protector but yet think that Nintendo would put in some type of foam or padding for that reason by now.If it didn't have any decent games I wouldn't bought it where I'm giving it 3 star review for the games that work on it.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: So, I honestly wasn't sure whether I should buy this or not since I've never played an Animal Crossing game before New Horizons. However, it has quickly become my most played game on the switch and it is so awesome to be able to play it on a system that looks this gorgeous. I don't know if this will go back in stock but I would recommend this to any Animal Crossing fans out there. My favorite part is definitely the island etchings on the back!Do not support scalpers!! I bought this system for $300 dollars and scalpers are out there trying to sell it for more than twice of the MSRP! If no one buys from them they will have no choice but to lower the price to a more reasonable level.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: the animal crossing switch is legit!! 5‚≠êÔ∏è STARS!!
review_body: Don‚Äôt be discouraged by the 1‚≠êÔ∏è star reviews; this is the real deal! You‚Äôre only allowed one animal crossing switch per amazon account to allow most people to get their hands on it without the extreme price gouge. The switch looks beautiful while docked & i‚Äôm a fan on the pastel blue/green & cream colored contrast. If you already played AC on another switch console, you‚Äôre now able to backup & transfer all of your save data by contacting Nintendo support. It‚Äôs a little tedious but, worth it if you have 100+ hours of hard work. 10/10 recommend to those who have been trying to get their hands on this in months! (GREAT HOLIDAY OR BIRTHDAY GIFT IDEA)

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: The coronavirus shortage is incredible. I  searched everywhere for 2 months and didnt want to pay the markup from third party sellers who were going for $500. I finally was able to order from amazon for $299.99 but on a 8 weeks delay. I placed the order and to my surprise it came in less than 2 weeks. Now on the console itself i give it 5 stars even though i wish it had more built in memory. My kid loves it. It's portable, so you can take it anywhere. The online gaming ecosystem though is build to milk you like a cow so one less star for that. Like most/all games are exclusive  and very expensive.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: On paper this is such a slick device, and combined with great Nintendo titles this was something I was excited for. BUT this system just isn't there yet. Right now I'm dealing with input lag that goes beyond controller or title specific issues. Right from the get go, setting it up (while in portable mode) felt odd. The touch screen and the attached joy-cons felt a bit slow. The input lag was the same speed as my PS4 with my TVs game mode OFF. Not a huge deal for many who will play most casual games, but annoying enough for me that titles like Cuphead and Enter the Gungeon are hindered. I do wonder if the newer portable only version doesn't have these issues, but I'm mainly interested in this as a home console.And it's online component? They still haven't caught up with Xbox Live from the 360 generation. Not a huge problem with Discord around, but still.Lot's of pluses for this system for sure, but this is mainly a message to people to try out the system first and decide for yourself if the input lag is bad enough to ruin your experience. A lot of people are very satisfied and don't even notice. I can see this not being a problem in games like Pokemon, or Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle. I've been playing "The Touryst", charming, relaxing, and a nice change of pace from what I usually play.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Game arrived with everything safely, nothing was damaged.

review_title: By far the best console nintendo has made since the gameboy advance
review_body: The Wii and Wii u were cool consoles, but i really only used them to play like mario, or gamecube games on, they were never really used to play "wii games". well the switch completely turns my opinion of nintendo consoles around. I have a gameboy advance, and still play the old pokemon games on it from time to time, but the switch is so much more than that. Its like combining all of the good things about a wii, a gameboy advance, and even an old n64, and packing it all into one box, that can even be taken on the go.I am super excited to own one, and i cant wait for more switch games to come out, BOTW, lets go eevee, Smash, the upcoming pokemon sword, and mario odyssey are my definite favorites.THOUGH THEY NEED TO FIX JOYCON DRIFT (sigh)

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: Nintendo's handheld genius has matched their console experiments to create the Switch. I use it mostly in handheld mode but docking it is seamless. It has a lot of games for me to enjoy, a lot of games for non-gamers to enjoy, and games that entire groups can enjoy. It feels like the best console I've ever owned.Between the Nintendo 1st party titles like the amazing Zeldas (Breath of the Wild and Link's Awakening) the many top-notch indie games that are flooding the Nintendo shop (Gris, Transistor, Indivisible) - I'm a content gamer.I have a PS4 and would play their amazing library of games intermittently. However, the Switch's library has caused my game time to exponentially increase. You would only do yourself a favour by buying it.

review_body: The red box tells you that this is the new model with twice the battery life. I never owned the previous model but I can tell you that I played in handheld mode mostly from 11:30 am to 4:30 pm with the exception of lunch, and I played 'til about 4 pm before I got the low battery warning. I watched a Youtube video that also showed that the colors on the screen are more accurate and the cooling system has been improved. So if you're wanting to play Witcher 3 on here, I recommend getting this one, as that power hungry game might warp the chassis from overheating. On top of that they are the same price right now, so I don't think anyone should get the old model until the price goes down.

review_title: You Can Get The Switch For MSRP!
review_body: I ordered the Nintendo Switch for MSRP and I thought it was too good to be true, but I ordered it Thursday and it came Monday! The website I used to help me find stock was stockinformer.com. It alerts you the minute there's Switch stock and you just have to be quick enough to buy it. It may take a few times and a few clicks but I was eventually able to purchase mine and I love this thing! It's really helped me curb boredom. I hope this helps anyone and please don't buy a Switch from any of these 3rd parties jacking up the price.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I already own a Switch but wanted to pick one up for my fiancee to have fun during quarantine. She is someone who has never played video games and didn't like them on the few occasions I tried to play a multiplayer game with her. Managed to pick up a used one (that looked virtually new) from Amazon Warehouse for about $240, which was a steal. She is really enjoying it and slowly becoming a regular gamer (1-2 hours a day), and the Switch has several games that are great for newcomers. She prefers handheld mode while I almost exclusively play it on my TV, so having that option is awesome.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: Our 4-1/2 year old loves it!!  We knew she was a little young for it but she needed something to fill a little time during the day.  She stays busy doing activities and school type work but she needed some downtime that wasn‚Äôt just watching TV.  This is perfect.  Paw Patrol game was perfect for her to start learning how to play video games.  Since then, she has graduated to a Yoshi game that has her problem solving.  She only spends about 30-45 minutes On it a day, total.  We also downloaded some coloring books and puzzle games.  She loves those.  Highly recommend but watch the screen time.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_body: I'm suppose to love the Switch, but I don't.  I think it's a bad deal overall.1) Nintendo Online doesn't offer much compared to the Wii virtual console days.  There's no Metroid games from the GC/Wii/Advance era.  Nearly all the games for the switch look like something from the 90's when flash games were popular. But the games are priced as if they're made out of gold.2) The frame rate on this console is poor. Yeah, some games reach a respectable 30fps, but I'd say most games fall below that.3) The dock is very woobly, it doesn't lock in, and it's very easy to scratch up the screen.4) There is no wired connection out of the box.  Why should I have to buy an adapter for that?  If you play online seriously, you use a wired connection.5) Here's what really bugs me.  There's no web browser on this thing.  No web browser for a mobile device? Are you kidding me?  This also leads to bizarre consequences.  Since there's no reviews on the Nintendo store, you're forced to go to third party sites for reviews... but you can't, because there's no web browser.  LMAO! And I had to create my nintendo account on a PC!  ROFL!Conclusion:I'll stick with the PC, Xbox and Playstation.  If these issues ever get resolved, I'll reconsider.  It's an interesting design, but it's all hype - little value.  $300 is way overboard for this gimmicky soy toy.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: Nintendo switch,  Good system, terrible quality control
review_body: The switch is a very nice system, read the reviews of wobbly joy con‚Äôs which there are many of but figured what are the chances I get one with that issue, Ordered it as a christmas gift, arrived on time the week before, christmas day, present gets opened and of course the joy con is wobbling, not enough to come loose but enough that it would definitely preoccupy while you play. Not for nothing but nintendo is getting to dollar, offering the worst deals on the switch and with the switch being it‚Äôs big hit , still can‚Äôt have quality control, the switch should feel as solid as a tank, not cheap when the joy con wiggles right out if the box and nintendos policy for fixing their mistake in my particular right out if the box defect is that they might send you a replacement which might be the plain grey/black instead if the colored joy con that I paid for is imo,a disgusting business practice, way to stand by their flagship product and instantly  turned me into a never by another nintendo product for anyone person. Listen, its a nice system but the quality is lacking and their support even for their mistake is insulting, so buyer beware, you‚Äôre playing quality roulette.

review_body: I got this for my 11-year-old daughter for Christmas and she LOVES it. Turns out my 5-year-old and husband enjoy playing on it as well! It's not a nice size screen and it's really cool that you can play it on the go or hook it up and play on the TV. You do need to make a Nintendo account, though, if you don't already have one in order to play on it, but overall set up was easy and didn't take too long. While the system was expensive it was definitely worth the investment! I do suggest getting a case to keep it in to keep it safe when not in use, though.

review_body: The switch is honestly the perfect console. Being able to easily transition from a portable console on the go to a docked console connected to your TV is everything I wanted. When I am tired and no longer want to sit at the TV and play, I grab it and jump in bed and just continue. My only issue is quite technical: the resistance of the Joycon controller buttons is too high. Takes too much effort to press them down. I got a pro controller and the difference is astounding. I don't understand why the Joycons don't have "soft" buttons like the pro controller does.

Even forked out to buy another NEW micro sd card (same exact one that was giving errors) end result it wasn't the micro sd card. Now I have 2 brand new micro sd cards for the system that I cannot use. Sent it into nintendo after they determined that it was the reader. After they received it they claimed it was from damaged to the system and wanted to charge me for it. The system was in perfect condition, no scratches, hadn't been dropped within that week of owning the system.  I cant return the item since I chose to wait too long so its my loss. review_title: Came with broken game card reader
review_body: When I first received the switch I was so excited. Everything was in the box and it looked brand new.  At first I didn‚Äôt have enough to buy any physical games so I bought some games for sale on the E shop. And it worked great! But only till after the return date passed did I realize, the game card reader was broken! When I first played one of the games it seemed to work fine. But later when I removed the game and I inserted it again, it told me it couldn‚Äôt read the game card. Easy enough, just restarting the switch made it read. But now months have past and the only game card it seems to read is animal crossing. All my other games just wont read. Even a brand new copy of Minecraft. Since I believe I still have warranty, I wanted to contact Nintendo for repairs but it‚Äôs been shut down due to COVID. I hope I can get this fix. I‚Äôm very disappointed.

product_name: Nintendo Switch with Neon Blue and Neon Red Joy‚ÄëCon
review_title: This console is NOT a NORTH AMERICA console
review_body: Seller deliberately did not state that the console was for sale and use in either Korea/Phillipines/Dubia as it turned out after calling Nintendo and giving them the ups code the one I received was meant for the Phillipines. I called the seller Wacky Jacky and told them what was written on the bottom of the box, he then told me to please wait a minute while he got another from his warehouse and proceeded to verify what I said then said he was sorry and that he had no idea and that his distributor assured him it was a US (North America) console. He then said I feel really bad and was going to send me a $100 gift card but what he did was refund $100 of the purchase price thinking that I would then keep the system. I don't know why he thought I would keep the system when I already had my return authorization label printed out and told him I was returning it, never did I say I wanted to keep the system. Am I supposed to believe he didn't know it wasn't a North America console when even now he has edited his listing to let any future buyers know that what he's selling isn't intended to be sold in the US. The seller asked me to please edit my review and rating but I see no reason to change the stars although I did edit this review to include the conversation with him and the fact that he did not add a note to his product description to make buyers aware of the consoles region. BEWARE WHEN YOU ARE BUYING A SYSTEM THAT IT MAY NOT BE INTENDED FOR SALE IN THE US..... CONTACT THE SELLER BEFORE BUYING AND HAVE THEM VERIFY WHAT IS WRITTEN ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX
